reviews.review_title: How could this movie be so bad?
reviews.content: I am a guy, who loves guy movies... I was looking forward to seeing a dragon fighting with the army with cool special effects. All of this happened, however, this movie was the worst movie I have ever seen in my life.The story was standard, but the portrayal of the story was terrible. The scene transitions were the worst I have ever seen. Why would you walk out to a beach to relax if your life was in danger? The serpent dragon's actions itself was very poorly written... and the serpent dragon's attack capabilities varied widely throughout the movie, several times the main characters should have died.The director attempted to infuse a love story in the middle of the movie during the most stressful times, this movie was obviously not watched after it was made, I love movies, but had to force myself to finish watching it, thank god I did not buy this, I borrowed it from a friend.Do not buy this, do not rent it, just watch discovery channel... much more exciting.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as the people on IMDb said...but not as awesome as I'd thought
reviews.content: I'm being generous with this movie by giving it 7 because it is more worthy of a 6.5 out of 10 stars. But since there isn't any .5 ratings, I decided to round it off. But let me tell you about D-War. The story is very, very simple. The movie itself isn't very organized, as it is mostly destruction and explosions whole movie long. Secondo, I don't see why so many people think that the visual effects in this movie are good when they aren't really. In this movie, the dragons are clearly shown as 3-D, and you sort of have a feeling that if you could stick your hand through the TV, your hand would move right through the dragons. When you watch Eragon, for instance, you have a feeling that if you'd stick your hand through the TV, you'd feel Saphira's soft fur. I found the acting OK, some actors were good, others are plain horrible. Watch this movie one night after drinking maybe 6 beers and if there's nothing else on TV.

reviews.review_title: the crappiest movie in history!
reviews.content: Seriously, this is the worst movie i've ever seen! first of all, the Korean writer/director shamelessly stole the "dragon" legends from the Chinese and shamelessly claimed it's a Korean legend. How ignorant has someone to be in order to be able to do this? Anyways, Koreans like stealing legends and traditions from the Chinese, so, what can we expect? Second, the acting, the plot, and the directing are sooooooooooooooo bad that it succeeded in making me just gave up watching after the first 30 minutes and registered for a IMDb account at once to write this comment.Lastly, the CG is just OK. The motion of the bad soldiers are so stiff and not-looking-like-real at all. Eragon is much better, Transformers is way much better. And even the CG of Lord of the Rings from 6 years ago is still a lot better than D War.

reviews.review_title: Haters Abound
reviews.content: Haters are everywhere. Every film has its core, overzealous, die-hard fans who'll give it a 10 rating. But for some reason, this film is one of the very few that gets criticized for having the sort of fans. Why, because the fans are from Korea and not US? I just don't get it. The haters make it sound like people outside of Korea are all objective in their views. Not true.Go find the worst movies you've ever seen. You'd be surprised to see that each of those films have 10 ratings too. I just don't get this mentality of haters that just because they didn't think much of the film, all others who say otherwise are lying. Tsk Tsk.Also, there are plenty of haters that have rated this film 1, so stop whining.The biggest misperception: Koreans are sabotaging the rating system. Truth is, if Koreans really did want to manipulate the ratings, it'd have more than ~350 total ratings.And in case you haven't noticed, most of the thread starters and posters that spew hate on this film ARE Koreans. So, put a stop to this idea that all Koreans have somehow unified to mess with IMDb rating system. It didn't happen, and the evidence is clear.Just wait for its release in the States -09-14- and see for yourself. It won't be too late to rate the film then. Just because a few fans would rate the film 10 based on reasons that should not be relevant when rating a film, it doesn't make it right for you haters to rate the film 1 just to negate it. 1? 1? 1? Come on. 1? Really? 1? Again, -since it's worth repeating- even if you thought that, it doesn't mean all others who rate the film otherwise are wrong.You haters act like the lonely, introverted nutjobs who were the only child in their respective family, and were babied all their lives. Here's a free lesson: People (can) have different opinions.I enjoyed this film more than I enjoyed SpiderMan3, Fantastic4II among others I've seen in recent months. Those films received a ton of 10 ratings. Seriously, were either of 'em deserving of a 10 rating? I think not, but I won't put them down nor will I give those each film a 1 rating just for the sake of negating the 10 ratings like some of you are doing to D-War. Again, cut this BS idea that Koreans have swarmed the IMDb. Only about ~350 votes right now have been tallied, including about ~75 1 ratings. Enough said. Koreans can be very exuberant. If they wanted to swarm this place, it'd have 20,000 votes easily by this coming Monday. Easily, I might add. Don't confuse exuberance with what you claim 'false nationalism.'D-War isn't up to the standards set by the LOTR. I happen to think LOTR is one of the best films ever produced, by the way. But it isn't a B-movie that the haters are attempting the smear this film to be. If you're a fan of SF/Legend/CGI fan, go see it. Or at least afford this film enough respect to withhold the judgment until you see it. Don't let these perpetual haters discourage you.Thanks for reading, everybody!

reviews.review_title: Sniff... Sniff... Do I smell copyright infringement?
reviews.content: Dreadful... Pure and simple.I've seen numerous Asian "live-action" productions (vs. anime) and in comparison this one was the best, but that being said, it was by no means good."GREAT CGI and EFFECTS!" someone commented. Compared to the 'Godzilla' series of films, yes, compared to anything the West has put out, a strong and resounding "no". The CGI reminded me of cut scenes from a video game. The movie also seemed to "borrow" a lot of it's staging and battles from 'Lord of the Rings', which has been mentioned by others.When you have to have a huge amount of narration in an attempt to give credibility to the story, you know the movie is doomed from the start. Even with a back story of sorts, the storyline jumped around like a 'one-legged frog on a trampoline'.The acting was uneven. I could care less about any of the characters and by the end of the movie I was glad to see them gone.It almost seemed that nobody in the movie even cared about what was going on and walked through it, hoping their checks wouldn't bounce.In the end, the heavy, yet weak special effects, poor acting and abysmal directing caused this tanker ship full of turds to sink under it's own self-importance.

reviews.review_title: a waste of my expectations
reviews.content: I thought D-war would stun me with its magnificence, but the beauty was only left with its rich, unnecessary surplus effects that made the movie almost entirely boring and goes to twaddle. In an instance, I'm a quarter-fan of Jason Behr (no fully as you notice), and expected a flawless performance, indeed Jason Behr never failed my intuitions, but like other commentators pointed out as well, maybe the crew behind and the other cast brought the movie down. The story would be enthralling but was overly emphasized and applied in the film, the special effects was way too crazy but at some points made the scene quite unbelievably boring. I wish could have been fixed further more before cracking its shell and prance all the way to theaters, but the film was a failure.

reviews.review_title: This is the Leigh Scott of movies
reviews.content: Take Transformers(2007). Now get rid of the giant robots, the comedy, the romantic subplot, and the par storyline. Add nothing. You now have D-War. Most of the movie revolves around three things: (1) the most generic, predictable prophecy of any movie, (2) a guy and a girl somehow connected with this prophecy who have no intention of acting like they might possibly like each other, and (3) the entire population of Los Angelos running in random directions from things that aren't dragons while the generic armed forces refuses to admit that they suck at fighting things that aren't dragons. Calling this movie Dragon Wars is like calling Leigh Scott a good director because the only reptile that remotely resembles a dragon only appears in the last five seconds, and it looks for all the world like The Neverending Story's Falkor did it with a moose. I cannot comment on the visual effects of this movie, since, like a fool, I spent most of my time desperately trying to search for a plot, so I shall leave you at this: the D in D-War does not stand for dragon. It does not stand for anything.

reviews.review_title: On the subject of D-War and rockets
reviews.content: I went to see this movie with my Nephew, who is 14. He, of course, loved it and now will not stop talking about it at all. I have always been a big fan of Asian cinema and Korean CG (They do beautiful work for games...Lineage 2, Magna Carta). And I think the effects in D-War are very good. I give this movie 3 stars as it is enjoyable for younger audiences who thrive on mythical creatures and action.Sure it had so-so acting and some plot holes, but there are movies that are worse. I would say, if you are curious about this movie, you might want to wait and rent it on DVD. It would be a bit cheaper and you wouldn't feel as bad about the loss.On the subject of Ancient China/Asia and rockets. Gunpowder was discovered in China around the ninth century while they were looking for an elixir of life (odd that they found something destructive) Although they weren't like the ones in the movie, Rockets did exist and possibly as early as 1232 were used by the Chinese against the Mongols. And the first multi-stage rockets were used in the mid-14th century.(Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rockets)

reviews.review_title: Good God, who would let this thing finish production?
reviews.content: In all my 37 years of seeing movies I have NEVER asked for a refund for a movie ticket....until this film.first of all, a THIRD of the film is in Korean - no subtitles as I saw it in Korea - understandable, but I'm sorry - I expect non-English dialog to be subtitled in ANY Hollywood film.That would have been bad enough, but all the Korean scenes are SO out of touch with the reality of the Korean they're supposed to take place in - the clothes are all wrong, and the people are WAY too clean - this was a medieval period and the characters look like they just stepped out of a Korean soap opera. The bad glue-on facial hair made them even more laughable - most Asian men are incapable of growing proper facial hair - there are exceptions, but that's why you see very few Asian men with beards - but these dudes had some serious goatees.The writing is terrible. It's like they did a survey of all the Hollywood action movies and picked out the most common lines, then tossed them all higglety-pigglety into the script.Black Man:"It's time you took this" (hands White Man a gun) White Man:"Come on, you know I hate those things" The Black sidekick is SO ridiculously stereotyped it's almost nauseating. The fact that the main characters keep abandoning him to the bad guys in a fight makes me wonder why he would even be in the next scene, even if he survived.The film takes place in LA, but then for readily explainable reason, the final battle scene is in some fire-roasted plain in some alternate universe - Where the Hell did this Hell come from? Dunno! At the end of the movie, all the Koreans started clapping - I have NEVER heard Koreans clap at the end of a film - even at the Pusan International Film Festival, applause is sparse - but there was almost a standing ovation a the end of this fiasco.I stood up and gave a loud raspberry. Then I went to get my money back.When I went back to the box office, I was FUMING - they took one look at me and handed me my money back - no questions asked.Congratulations, D-War, you've done what no Hollywood film has ever done - made me demand (and get) my money back.

reviews.review_title: Two Hours of My Life...
reviews.content: Gone. Wasted. Forever lost.All on the simply abominable Dragon Wars movie.Okay, wait-- only an hour and a half, give or take. After all, there were trailers before the movie, and these I quite enjoyed.See, I went into the film expecting CGI, and to probably see the CGI, and to love it anyway, because there was action, and there were dragons, and there was lots of shoot 'em up. I could be happy, yes? But come ON. A semblance of acting, please? A smidgen of a logical plot? Some kind of SENSE to it all??? Do not see this movie. Spend your hour and a half on something more worthwhile. There are lots of things you could do. Chewing the tops off your weeds rather than using your gas-powered weed eater (to save the gas money) would be a worthier endeavor. Really.(Reprinted from Yvonne Navarro's LiveJournal.)

reviews.review_title: Great Show, but Not Good Enough
reviews.content: I just watched D-War on DVD, and I have to say, I'm quite impressed with how Korean managed to produced such a movie. The effect is very promising, the dragons, and the minions look pretty convincing and menacing and threatening. The good dragon was also a plus in this movie. But that's all I can praise from this movie.Yup. You heard me right. The only thing that I see as a plus in this movie, is the graphic and the special effect. Every tiny little bit of the effect is very good. The dragons look real enough for me. And how every destruction, explosion, and the way the dragon pass through every road, and the damage it caused, everything related to graphic and special effect is a plus.As for the story, it's just so-so. Not really good, but it's not that bad either. For the act, I have to say, it's not so good. The dialogues is kinda awkward. Everything they say just seem so, unnatural. You will know what I mean if you see it and hear it yourself.It's a recommendation for those who loves special effect and graphic and don't care about the story. But it's not a good recommendation for those who cares a lot about the story.I rate it 6/10

reviews.review_title: I haven't been this sad since Alone In The Dark!
reviews.content: This movie, granted, must have have been expensive on the graphics end; however, the acting and script were a bottom zero when it came to the budget. I didn't know anything about this movie when I unfortunately purchased my ticket and I regret knowing anything about it now. I must say that the giant lizards were not the highlight of the film, the moment the credits hit the screen I was ecstatic to leave the theater of doom. If this film was intended for children I would not recommend it. They may grow up one day thinking movies are supposed to be this bad. Truthfully, ERAGON was 100 times better. I am sure that everyone who worked on this film must have spent a long time trying to justify all the hours they spent lost in a conundrum of mayhem and missing pieces of thought. I wish this movie was all in subtitles...I take that back. I wish this movie was in a foreign language without subtitles so that I might have been able to make up my own dialog. I look forward to sequel, "Dragon Wars II, I lost my Marbles". Were any animals harmed while filming this movie?

reviews.review_title: extra points for effort
reviews.content: Those who hated this movie will probably continue doing so, but those merely disappointed with it may want to give it another chance.I saw this last year and felt disappointed; the acting is second rate and some of the story elements - even in the action sequences - abbreviated incoherently.However, watching it again yesterday, I was struck by how much the director was able to accomplish on a budget very limited by American standards, and by how much passion he demanded - and got - from his special effects people. The CGI in this film actually carries emotional weight which is not only rare but very difficult to accomplish (CGI is really a 'cool' medium, as Marshall McLuhan might remark). And what the director is really trying to accomplish with his storyline is not composition so much as orchestration - the construction is musical rather than dramatic.Does it achieve its intent? no, not completely. But neither is it a complete failure by any means. Rather than trying to figure out the film, go with the flow of it and you'll be surprised at how entertaining it really is.P.S. I'd rate it a seven, but give two extra points because it doesn't deserve the low rating it has here at IMDb.

reviews.review_title: Whew! Something terrible! More terrible than you can possibly imagine
reviews.content: I generously give this film a 3, just because I LOVE dragons. Let us start with the Los Angeles in this film, I guess police allow reporters to randomly walk into taped off crime scenes. I guess it's easy to track down the ONE person you are looking for in this mega-opolis, when there are over a hundred thousand girls with the same name Once again, "the heroine" walks to her car, the ONLY car in what appears to be a multi-leveled parking garage in downtown LA., of course, she will be approached The characters are all one dimensional with such flat lines, they may as well be flat-lined! So, there is corny stupid scenes, flat acting, flat characters, what more needs to be said except, why did I waste 89 minutes of my life watching this movie?

reviews.review_title: More Like a Summary of a Series
reviews.content: Movie Has Potential to become a Mini-Series.If you want a No Thinking show, filled with action, This movies can fit the Bill.Simple Dragon Movie, can be funny at timeCopied from quite few past movies like a Lord Of The Ring(LOTR) Copy,(Faith of the World Rest on Your Should lines) Good Verse Evil Army Battles. No Ring(LOTR), but a dagger to end it all. Try to have Massive Army of soldier,(Like LOTR). Nicer looking Creature as compare with like of Godzilla or T-Rex from The Lost World: Jurassic Park (Although not as fast, American Cars can Out run the Monster) Even have the requested lane of car destruction scene, similar to ID4.Monster climb building, like some Ape. Who can forget the Apaches verse Monster part, don't they ever learn, look all around, or don't use Apache (Godzilla) Why is the G-Men(FBI)dress in Black? (MIB influence?) Spoiler Alert, Look out for the Copy of Raiders of the Lost Ark, the Spirit coming out of the Body to Attack Evil scene, near the Ending.See this Show if you are feeling down. It did cheer me up, the copying of scene/theme from several movies, brought back flashback from happier days.For the Producer(s) Story is Complex, and filled with potential, a lot of areas can be further developed.I.e - Background during the Ancient Times can be spread over three episodes. The Chase Scene, another few more shows, Hospital alone can be two shows.Have Potential. Need Better scripts.

reviews.review_title: Recommendable..I saw this today..
reviews.content: It was pretty good.. The most impressive part was the last which I haven't seen in the trailer. The fighting scene between evil and good imoogi,and Good imoogi who happened to bite a Blue magic YEOIJU and turned himself to the DRAGON(It was awesome scence,,..reminded the dragon in the DRANGONBALL_Z,when young GOKU make wish to the DRAGON)and fought against the evil imoogi with super power..It was great. I 'am really big fan of DRAGONBALL Z and I think D_WAR was enough to give such a pleasure. I could find no bleeding scenes even though there were many fightings. I think it was mainly due to the consideration for kids' watching. that really made me feel some reality wanting,though. But it's worth to pay for this.

reviews.review_title: A huge joke, that wasn't supposed to be funny, but was!
reviews.content: There is so much wrong with this absolute garbage it's not even funny, It's plain embarrassing, and goes to show that the South Korea has a long way to go when it comes to making a CG heavy flick. Now I know this made all sorts of money in it's homeland, but here in North America it tanked. The Story, was so bad that I felt sorry for everyone involved. This is exactly how not to make a summer film. I felt bad to see an Oscar nominated actor Robert Forster) be part of this garbage. There is something completely pathetic about more and more companies trying to copy the tried and true and completely overly done Hollywood formula. I realize monster CG fights are cheaper to make now more than ever that they can now afford to make, but not only are they done poorly, a lot of us are tired of all special effects with little to no story! *cough* "Spiderman 3" w/ it's hundred plot points and twenty different characters for example. I laughed at the absurdity of the story, the dialog, and the absolute terrible acting! Now as bad as this was S. Korea did do another CG Monster flick called "The Host" and it was pretty good. It wasn't great but it seemed Oscar worthy compared to this. Their best decision though was working on getting a pretty good script, and getting their monster done by ILM. (George Lucas' Oscar winning special effects company Industrial Light & Magic.) I think that if you were to watch this w/a bunch of buddies and didn't take it all seriously, and made fun of the terrible wooden acting, the crummy special effects, then maybe it might be a fun watch, I don't know. I know that I won't ever watch it again and if it was showing on an airplane I would be tempted to jump out just to get away from it.

reviews.review_title: This made SoaP look like an Oscar Winner
reviews.content: When I first saw the previews for this movie, I'm not gonna lie. I got excited. I mean, what could be better than dragon on dragon warfare? But after seeing this movie, I realized I had fallen victim to false advertising. While there is great talk of Dragons throughout this movie, there is only one true dragon, and he does not appear until the end of the movie.But what seriously bothered me the most was the lack of continuity in the plot of this movie. Seriously, this movie had more holes in the plot than the movie Holes. From the dream sequence at the beginning to the unnecessary jumping back and forth from one moment to the next, I felt more confused about things than any other movie I had ever seen. The massive amounts of time that were left out of this movie too also bothered me. For example, after escaping from the evil Immogi yet again, Ethan and Sarah manage to get out of L.A. in an FBI car while the pseudo-dragons army fights the U.S. Military. As we are in the car watching what is behind us, all of a sudden, it cuts to the 2 driving in the desert and Sarah asking Ethan "Why are we in Mexico?" You know what, I was asking the same thing at that point too. How in the world did you get to Mexico without stopping, and I also wanted to know what the conversation was like, because I seriously doubt that they made small talk.All in all, I do not think that this movie is worth anyone's time, unless you feel like losing 90 minutes of your life and spending money to support bad movies.

reviews.review_title: Wow, this movie was dumb! But wow, did I have a good time anyway!
reviews.content: Wow, this movie was dumb! But wow, did I have a good time anyway! At some points it's almost painfully illogical and cheesy and the acting was more or less none existent but there is just so much nice action going on throughout most of the movie it's just a great ride. It even had a couple of really funny moments (the mighty bad knight getting hit by a car twice in 2 or 3 minutes for example really made me laugh, well executed *g*).There are many movies with better special effects but in my opinion what you get here is just fine and you get loads of them. If you like monster movies like Godzilla where the whole city gets destroyed, this is just what you wanna watch. When the show down starts you really feel like in the middle of a huge war zone.You have to be able to switch your brain off while this movie runs but if you are able to do so you will be rewarded plenty.I give it a 5/10.

reviews.review_title: Dragon Wars, A Horrible Defeat
reviews.content: I'll be honest, I thought this movie would have the action and magnitude of Transformers or King Kong, but it turned out that it was not even close to being that good. I thought that the plot had so much potential and the action sequences were pretty good and had me on the edge of my seat. I think what made this movie a horrible disaster was that the plot became to confusing since it flashes back within a flashback and they did not do a good job explaining the story. Poor Robert Forster tried so hard not to laugh during his monologue that it took me right out of the movie.The acting was poor and the writers did not develop the characters as well as they should have. I think that they moved into the character's story rather to quick. The FBI agents should have had a bigger part and the team screamed X-Files, since they found out about the dragons because the FBI has a paranormal investigations unit. It questions if the actors were encouraged enough, ultimately questioning the capability of the director. You could tell that they had difficulty staying within their characters since the characters themselves were so ridiculous.The plot was the biggest disaster of them all. It had so much potential that the writers didn't even execute it correctly. It right away rushed into it rather that building it up and the whole "ancient-warriors-in-present-day-L.A." was good but it became to silly. The questionable presence of a giant snake dragon slithering across a hospital, and no one knowing of it, was hard to believe. They did not give headroom to expand on the star-crossed lovers or the conflict between the good guy and the bad guy. They mention the good Inoogi over and over again but we don't' see him till the end and even that battle between good and bad was ridiculous. It begs the question as to why are there dragons and why the hell can't anybody see these things.In summation, the movie wanted to be a huge A-budge action flick but instead it lacked everything an action movie should have had. I hate to say it but, if Michael Bay would have produced or even directed this tragedy, it would have been so much better in every category. Michael Bay, where were you when we really needed you?

reviews.review_title: Not the best but watchable, fun and something new.
reviews.content: I think people are kind of too harsh on this film.I have watched so many stupid movies in my life and I can't deny that I actually enjoyed many of those stupid movies and I know people do love stupid movies. That's how Hollywood can keep producing stupid blockbuster movies because they know people will watch.Anyway, there are many reasons people go to the cinemas. sometimes you want to enjoy good stories and good acting but also sometimes, you just want to turn off your brain for a while and have fun.Basically, I don't understand people trying to analyse this movie because this movie is just meant to be fun.Like you watch Bruce Lee films to see him kicking some bad ass.You watch the Jurasic park to see those dianosours destroying and killing.And if you want to enjoy a big giant serpent destroying the whole L.A city, this movie will give you full satisfaction.Watch "Gone with wind" if you want to enjoy stories and acting.

reviews.review_title: good movie
reviews.content: This movie was better than "Scary movie 1" & "Scary movie 2" & "Scary movie 3" . Think about how many bad movies you've seen. This New Korean Film Director is from Korea, and this country never made SF Movies before. Everybody said he will make horrible movie because those who were cowards (so called themselves "Korean Movie Director") were too afraid of the bad comments and they only blamed for lack of materials, supports and techniques. I bet only few of his own country people helped him and supported him. It's a shame. However, this director is brave enough to try with his best effort to make the First Korean SF movie in the American Film Industry. We all should give him a credit because he deserves to have one. He surely needs to make more improvement on his next movies, but for the first starter, this movie did not waste my time or money.Like I said earlier, this movie was better than some of movies I have seen before.

reviews.review_title: When she's good she's very very good but when shes bad shes horrible
reviews.content: I am a novice student of Korean culture and language so the movie didn't seem completely nonsensical to me as it did many American viewers. I had been warned that it was a modern Godzilla flick and with that in mind I enjoyed the film. As an animator it was hard to watch in some places. The composites were blurry and the human animation in some scenes were animatic level quality. When you realize that this was their first jab at a project of this scope however, it is easy to forgive the occasional bad edit or overlooked scene without any CG characters in it*. The "wow" moments were truly good ones. I found myself saying "cool" out loud several times. A lot of the huge battle scenes reminded me of the attempt at Star Wars episode I. Unfortunately this film did have a heavy Jar jar element, only without the funny bits. Not in that it had a CGI character, but rather as if Jar Jar were the one directing the film. There are some very strange moments, such as the sudden cut at the end to a wasted landscape that has no explanation except that the hero is rendered unconscious and wakes up there. For most audiences this is unforgivable. There were many such moments in the movie but this was the most jarring of them all. Then there are the "wow" moments that left my jaw hanging open at the absolute badness of the utterly horriblethe amateurish way they were done. The scene where the hero saves the girl by taking a bullet meant for her at point blank range, and then stands up as if nothing had happened. The stereotypical FBI bad guy might as well have sneezed on him. Again there is no explanation for this seemingly inexplicable moment in the film. But if you take the film at its face value, it can be enjoyable. You just need to lower your expectations a few notches. Well, make that a lot of notches. I wouldn't mind seeing it again if I can fast forward through all the dumb bits to see the action again.Papa* In one shot the military is firing on the horde coming down the canyon between the buildings. The camera is behind the tanks looking toward where the enemy horde should be but behind the smoke is an empty street.

reviews.review_title: DON'T BE CONFUSED by the controversy!!!
reviews.content: DON'T BE CONFUSED by the controversy!!! This movie is just AWFUL!!! AWFUL!!! AWFUL!!! (I won't go into the details as others have done so already.) It's not worth the money to see it at the theater. Anyone who attempts to cloud the issue are either people who have stakes in D-war or fanatic fans of Shim Hyung Rae. (Shim Hyung Rae is a very influential comedian in Korea.) You will ask me then "Why should I believe you? Like why should you care whether I see D-war at the movies or not?" Well, to me it's a matter of principle. A good movie should succeed. Bad movies should fail. This is not the case with D-war up till now. And this frustrates me. Sort of like seeing a criminal get away with a heinous crime and being helpless to do anything about it. I felt as if I had to do something against this awful movie that gobbled up my 7000 won and wasted 90 minutes of my time. Anyway everybody agrees that D-war is a bad movie not worth the money to see at the theater. But nevertheless, over 7 million people have gone to the theater to see D-war in Korea. (In fact, this is the main reason why Freestyle Realising was encouraged into opening D-war in more than 1500 screens on 9/14) How did this unthinkable thing happen? Several reasons come to my mind...1. Tremendous marketing effort...The guy who markets D-war definitely is a professional worth his salt. He's a ruthless individual who makes use of any and all opportunity. Like for example, a few days after D-war opened in Korea, a gay director made a negative comment about D-war in his personal blog. Normally this shouldn't have amounted to anything as few people visited his blog. But what ensued afterward is a gay bashing thing like I've never seen in Korea. (Normally, homosexuality is a non-issue that Koreans are too embarrassed to even talk about in Korea. But not this time.) The marketers of D-war claimed that Shim Hyung Rae was a "good Korean" who made "good movies" that were suitable for children's viewing, while other directors in Korea made homosexual or violent movies that were bad for children. Of course this is quiet ridiculous. Shim's movies are just AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL and so completely TASTELESS.. (I'm 100% sure that D-war is actually more harmful to children than a pornographic snuff film.) If you wanna see an example of Shim's work, see Yonggary aka Reptilian. You should be able to download it somewhere. And you'll see what I mean. The only difference between D-war and Yonggary is the CG.. The drama part has not improved at all. It's become worse. Well, actually, at least Yonggary was sort of watchable. You could write it off as a really really really badly made cheesy amateur B- movie. But not D-war. D-war is definitely NOT a B-movie. You can clearly see that enough money ($70 MILLION dollars in all) has been spent on it to at least qualify it as a non-B movie. So you can't but help drawing comparisons with other non-B movies and it just makes it simply too unwatchable. It just sort of makes you feel like a complete fool. No, I didn't say that right. You sort of feel as if you're BECOMING a complete fool by watching D-war. As if you're being contaminated by something really sickeningly disgusting. Even people who like watching "bad" movies should stay away from D-war. How can I explain what the affect of watching D-war is like? Like for example, imagine you went to the hospital to get surgery to remove your appendix. And the doctor gave you brain surgery instead and removed your pre-frontal lobe. That's what seeing D-war is like. It's just simply AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL...2. Korean Patriotism.Koreans are among the most nationalistic people in the world. Most Koreans feel that it is their "duty" to go see D-war because D-war is being exported to the States. 3. The trailers..Oh, the D-war trailers for D-war were beautifully crafted by the D-war marketing people and I can't give them enough praise!!! Too bad the actual movie is nothing like the trailers. Well, actually, I've changed my mind. Please DOOOOOOOOOO see this movie!!!!!! So there would be more people to join the cause against this movie!!! I'm beginning to think that maybe there should be something like an "director's license" or something. The public should be protected from people like Shim Hyung Rae. Like if you were to make a list of people who shouldn't be allowed to make movies, Shim Hyung Rae would be at the top of the list.

reviews.review_title: 50 minutes of my life I'll never get back
reviews.content: The reason my title says 50 minutes of my life that I will never get back is because even though the move is 90 minutes long, I actually walked out after 50 minutes. Try as I might, I couldn't subject myself to any more of the horrible acting, awful story line, lame humor and video game quality CG.Until today, I have never walked out of a move in my life so I tried very hard to find a reason to stay and watch the movie but I just couldn't come up with a single reason.I have read all the comments from some foreign viewers touting this movie as the next Star Wars. In my opinion, movies should not be what makes your proud of your nationality. If you are really having a hard time finding something to celebrate, celebrate communism, it is much more enjoyable to live through than D-War.

reviews.review_title: This is the most amazing movie ever!!
reviews.content: I saw this movie twice at the theater. When i first saw this movie, i thought to myself "Wow this is Pure Brilliant!" I LOVE the characters! The storyline is simple & great! The direction is Amazing! CGI Is Awesome! See loads of different kinds of monsters! The Characters Are ones you can really warm up to. There is Really Good humor. In my opinion, this is one of the best movies in movie history. Everyone should LOVE this movie, if they don't then there is something wrong with them.

reviews.review_title: Dragon Wars (D-Wars) was Great
reviews.content: The film was kind of good for an action film. i rate it 10/10 for it being a good film for children and maybe adults (if they are interested in it). I am actually weighting for the film to make a second 1 (if it happens.) The legend part at the beginning part of the movie was hard to first follow along with it, but then you kind of get it when it gets into more detail in the legend.I did find the battle in the city's, the serpent chasing after the 2 people and the battle at the end between the 2 serpents actually really good.The age limit that I would give the film would be 6 and over. The film didn't really contain much gruesome images and bloody scenes. Over all I found it a pretty good film.

reviews.review_title: special effects kids
reviews.content: Dragon Wars is not an adventure film which is implied in the opening. It loses differentiation between the good guy versus bad guy monsters towards the end. The romance does not appeal to anyone. Too broad commercial aims hurt this movie. Otherwise, the story is not hard to follow as the other critics say.The director is not a storyteller or an artist. The director will make a good special effects director. He favors every explosion and fantastical creature. He tried to include every special effects shot. He needs to edit this film more.Put some money into a decent script next time.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining
reviews.content: I rented this movie yesterday and in the overall theme of the whole picture I enjoyed it. I watched the Special Features on the DVD, which I found to be further enjoyable. Before yesterday I knew nothing about this movie. The artwork done in developing this movie was brilliant.In watching this movie at the start I wondered if it were some kind of comedy or a spoof due to the acting and silliness of some of the scenes that were almost childishly stupid. But, it was due to these scenes that added a flavor and charm to this movie you seldom see. I was unaware the director was a comic or was Korean (or that the film was Korean). In view of this and knowing Korean culture as well as I do, I can now give a better comment and appreciate this film more. I wish that the director had not hidden the Korean flavor to his movie. I liked the concept of the setting to be in the USA, but I do feel that more of the roles should have been Korean to give more balance to the imoogi legend theme as well as to the movie itself for the audience to be more accepting of those rough scenes with both comedical and poor line deliveries, etc.All in all, I was wowed by the creativeness and imagination put forth in this film that is not seen in many these days. I do like Korean movies and would like to see more. This film was a work of art, for sure, and is entertaining. It does need fixing, but I wouldn't tell people to not watch it.

reviews.review_title: Poor; everything was poor, unless it was weak (SPOILERS)
reviews.content: D-Wars started out in circa 1500 and should really have stayed there as the storyline was introduced commendably quickly allowing plenty of time for some character development and plenty of action/fighting scenes between protagonists wielding basically the same hand-to-hand type weapons (excluding the 'Stalin' organs etc). Also the dark-army were menacing, the SFX good and it would have been interesting if the young couple had fought the dark lord instead of more-or-less committing suicide and becoming reincarnated in 21st Century LA.The reincarnated male lead was played by a suitably weak actor poorly portraying a weak character who could think of nothing but running from a dragon that gave him (and Sarah) every opportunity to run and escape whenever it caught up with them! Sarah, the reincarnated female-lead, was not a great deal better and God knows what they found to fall in love with as neither of then had a personality. The lead performances mirror the entire cast who gave uniformly poor performances.The script was indescribably poor, and not only suffered from the major weakness of borrowing already hackneyed lines from other films, but neither developed the characters or even the plot.The overall premise of the story was not particularly poor, but the developing storyline and continuity were excessively poor in that nothing made any particular sense and it was so random! E.g. Why Mexico? How did the soldiers know to go to some mine-workings? Where did the end scene take place? How could he get shot at point blank range and get up again unharmed? The battles were curiously flat; with tanks, helicopters, dragons etc they should have been good but somehow I felt them to be un-involving and, well, boring. Perhaps it was the SFX which I felt to be mediocre, or perhaps I just like close up and personal as in 'Jason and the Argonauts' or 'Aliens'.I do not care if the film was Korean, Japanese, American or Mongolian! I judged it on its own merits, which are very few. Children may like it; but not discerning ones.

reviews.review_title: Guess what the monster is, no really
reviews.content: Oh wow, this stank more than that one film, "Hideous!" why is it so horrible? Well, first of all, the dragon wars is not at all the star of the film, the film is slow and focuses more on action than thrill, plus a ignoble girl gets blown up. Dear Lord, is there a God??!! This movie, oh God, I can't believe it, it's so bad it hurts. Really, it hurts. It hurts to watch it and it's totally a waste of time. Enough said.

reviews.review_title: "The line (of good flicks) is a dot to Hyung-rae" (Joey T)
reviews.content: To quote Leonard Pinth-Garnell, "Now that wasn't so good, was it". WOWWent to see this with a friend last night and decided it was a 21st century version of the Japanese SciFi Monster movies of the 60s. One of those director's kids saw LOTR and said 'I can do that.' The CG was in fact the only thing worthwhile, yet it did not rise anywhere near the line of the overwhelming badness of script, acting, sound-mixing, plot, yadayadayada.We came out with some useful metaphors, though. The lady who watches the bad guy walk through the fence, tries it herself and bounces off it with the stupefied look on her face is all of us who paid the $8.50 to see it!The glowing pearl at the end that the dragon carries off into the heavens is the two hours we wasted and can't get back!

reviews.review_title: A sci-fi movie that is worth a watch
reviews.content: I want to start out that I am a very big sci-fi fan and I do not write comments very often. I can not spell is one reason but I felt the need to defend this movie. If you watch the special features you will see this is a movie made in South Korea and is the most expensive movie ever made there. The director made this movie for international viewing and is why he made it in English also he used American actors and world famous American composer who did not do it for money (cause there was not much to get). south Korea is not a very rich country and not known for movie making and trying to appeal to the American people I think they did a great job making this movie. It does not have the special effects as let say transformers but for the money spent I think the special effects are great. I and my family seen this movie at the theater and just watched it again on DVD. We all enjoyed it. There are a few shots that could have be done different that would have made the movie a little better but all in all I give the Korean film makers a 10 star(part for effort) and hope there next sci-fi with a little more money available will give us more great entertainment. If you are a sci-fi fan I think you will fined it enjoyable to.

reviews.review_title: Once every 500 years, a Korean movie like this comes around
reviews.content: The movie was apparently a big hit in S. Korea. Is it misguided patriotism to support the movie when the legend is actually Chinese, the setting is American and the protagonists are white? I don't know. So in a nutshell, the movie has: The Hills chick clone, the Mac Guy clone, cheesy FX, stereotypical African-American sidekick, and many, many unintentionally hiilarious scenes. So in essence S. Korea now has caught up with Japan and shown it's capable of producing its own version of Godzilla. They're a little late to the game, but who can blame the director - making a national blockbuster is akin to building a large phallic building for many developing economies. Everyone wants to have one. The Russian produced 'Inhabited Island', Chinese produced 'The Promise'. They're all terrible films, laden with sub-par digital FX, mediocre story and ham acting. The money certainly would have been best used elsewhere, but it ended up on Rifftrax list, so I'm not complaining.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time.
reviews.content: This is the worst movie I've seen in years. I'm amazed it didn't go straight to video. The only worthwhile part was the dragon graphics as the very end. It was badly written, badly edited, badly directed, and badly acted. There were maybe a dozen ten year olds (clearly the target market) in the showing I saw, and two of them left halfway through. I can't imagine seeing it again to know if there were larger audiences.The ten minutes spent explaining the plot at the beginning would have been better if it had been ten minutes of back story. The whole movie would have been better replaced with the 1507 Korea back story.The producers spent a lot of money on CG effects, some of which would have been better spent on the script. Nearly every character in this movie was so cliché they could have been played by a lobby card. The main characters had no chemistry, the police were incompetent, the feds were evil, and the military was reduced to helicopter pilots going 'Uh-oh' before crashing. The bad guy's voice was so badly done it was almost funny.Don't see it, don't rent it, don't waste your money.

reviews.review_title: Hulking CGI-fest tries to do for fantasy what Transformers did for sci-fi
reviews.content: A lame and pointless CGI fest in which the entire budget is spent on huge, hulking and elaborate city-wide battle sequences of monsters versus the army in scenes that feel inspired by TRANSFORMERS. The opening storyline, which gets entirely forgotten about around the half hour mark, is absolutely cringe-worthy, along the lines of something equally ridiculous and kid-friendly like DRAGONBALL EVOLUTION.The acting is even worse: this is a South Korean production, made in collaboration with Hollywood so that we get a load of young and inexperienced American actors popping up in central roles. It goes without saying that they're horrible, although eagle-eyed viewers may notice a slumming Robert Forster (JACKIE BROWN) turning up in one of those world-weary mentor type roles.Meanwhile, I do have to admit that the CGI is impressive. Those massed pitched battles are carried out with gusto and a maximum of destruction, and the creatures on show put to shame the kinds of low-budget CGI monstrosities that prop up many a television movie. But, in the end, without a decent storyline to support them, who cares about the quality of the effects on show? DRAGON WARS might as well be a cartoon for all it's worth, and any viewers over the age of five are going to find it lacking.

reviews.review_title: Confusing extended Korean prologue
reviews.content: There's a whole convoluted Korean folktale backstory to this movie that takes up almost the first 30 minutes. There's a girl with magic. There's an evil guy with powers and a dragon. The heavens sent two warriors to defend the girl. It happens every 500 years. Blah Blah Blah.It's all very confusing with a lot of Korean names. And quite frankly, most of it doesn't matter. The CGI battle in Korea reminds me of the Star Wars ground combat. It's a lot of explosions for very little excitement.Then it's modern day LA. Ethan Kendrick (Jason Behr) is a TV reporter, and Jack (Robert Forster) owns an antique store. Together they are the reincarnation of the two heavenly warrior sent to protect Sarah Daniels (Amanda Brooks) against an army of magical dragons and warriors.After a slow section where everybody find one another, the movie turns into more CGI battles. Jason Behr and Amanda Brooks are not the best actors around. There's only so much that Robert Forster can do. Craig Robinson does a couple of funny bits but they hardly matter. The battle in LA is kinda fun, but that's the only watchable part. It ends in a confused mess around a CGI fortress with the dragon. I couldn't tell you what happened.

reviews.review_title: Oh my god this was AWFUL!
reviews.content: I had high hopes for this movie after seeing the action packed trailer, but now I know why there was not dialogue in the trailers.... BECAUSE IT'S GOD AWFUL!!! This movie sucked the big one in soooo many ways! Poor acting, stupid dumb characters, bad directing and edited like a bad fan movie, next to zero plot and what plot there was could have made barely 30mins of movie, terrible set pieces, badly directed cgi... etc... etc... etc... Looks like they blew the budget on the cgi and forgot about the rest, even though the cgi was fairly poor by todays standards (see transformers)... in fact, that's my advice to you if you are thinking about seeing this movie, SEE TRANSFORMERS!... even if you've already seen it 50 times already, see it again and don't bother with this RUBBISH!I feel like suing for the hour and 40 minutes of my life I can't get back! ;)

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Horrible
reviews.content: Prior to last night, the worst movie I had ever seen was Millennium with Kris Kristofferson and Cheryl Ladd. D-War (Dragor Wars) has now officially taken that crown. Almost all the other posts have pretty much summed up what sucked about this movie, but the thing that disappointed me most was that there was no real war between dragons (which I incorrectly assumed there would be based upon the title). Besides the cheesy smaller flying things that vaguely resembled dragons, the only real dragon you saw was the Mulan looking thing at the very end. Anyway, don't waste your time or money on this pile of trash. To think I considered buying this on Blu-ray.

reviews.review_title: D-readful.
reviews.content: When elderly antiques dealer Jack (Robert Forster) fakes a heart attack so that he can be alone with young Ethan Kendrick (Cody Arens), and proceeds to tell him a bizarre story about how they have a special connection, the boy doesn't turn on his heels screaming 'stranger danger', but listens attentively, despite the tale being virtually incomprehensible. Hell, he doesn't even get a Werther's for being such a good boy.Weird old Jack's story goes something like this (possibly): every half a millennium, a Yuh-Yi-Joo is born who has the power to transform an Imoogi into a powerful celestial dragon. 500 years ago, evil Imoogi Buraki, aided by his Atrox army, a swarm of Bulcos and squadron of mighty dawdlers (I kid ye not), was narrowly thwarted by the Yuh Ji Yoo's appointed protector. Soon, Buraki will return to seek out the latest Yuh-Yi-Joo and it is up to Ethan, the new protector, to ensure that it doesn't succeed.Fifteen years later and Ethan (now played by Jason Behr with floppy hair) has all but forgotten his strange encounter with the old man (probably on account of his story being so crap), but gradually begins to understand his destiny when the massive serpent turns up to trash the city in its hunt for a mysterious girl named Sarah (Amanda Brooks).Written and directed by Korean Hyung-rae Shim, but starring an all-American cast, D-War is a colossal mess, a big-budget CGI-packed monster movie that throws an awful lot at the screen (including an elephant being eaten by a snake and a huge oriental dragon) but still somehow manages to be about as exciting as an episode of The Waltons: the script is all over the place, virtually every performance is diabolical (although you have to feel for the actors wrestling with such lousy dialogue), and the huge-scale action scenes, although visually impressive, completely fail to engage the viewer due to the sheer inanity of proceedings.

reviews.review_title: Unbelievably bad that I hoped you didn't pay to see it

Who proofread/edited/approved this script? Whoever did must be banned from the Screen Writers Guild for life. This is supposed to be the BEST of Korea. Someone take them off the map please. SO RETARDED. This is a bad day in history for mad little people with big cheeks of the world who live off of rotten vegetables. I even heard the ending in Korea had screen which said "We will release this to the world!!" or something along those lines. My response please take it back please.

reviews.review_title: Tries Too Hard With The FX
reviews.content: A lot of people on this page have complained that DRAGON WARS is let down by the story . I disagree it's not so much the story/plot/premise that is at fault but the storytelling itself . For some need only known to the producers several characters have to experience a " they wake up only to find the danger they were in was in fact a nightmare " which becomes very annoying . The only function these nightmares seem to have is to show some CGI special effects which are terribly cartoonish . One wishes the production had limited the number of effects so that when they do come they'd be more convincing There's also another element that let's DRAGON WARS down and that is it's trying to be as inoffensive as possible . This is personified by the opening flashback scene in ancient Korea which sees the villains attacking a village with their dragon army . It's not on a level with Peter Jackson's RETURN OF THE KING but it had the potential to be impressive . I said " potential " because the editing is done in a very blink and you'd miss it technique similar to QUANTUM OF SOLACE which will have you thinking the more violent bits of the scene have been left on the editing floor

reviews.review_title: Good effects in gibberish story
reviews.content: I read thw wikipedia page to help mevwith a plot synopsis and, frankly, I'm not going to bother - it's a cross between Buffy's baxjstory and the Dragonball movie, only with good and bad huge dragons which are actually snakes, and magic stormtroopers. Or something.Despite a US cast, headed by unknowns, but with some bigger names further down, and despite being set in LA, this film is Korean. reviews.review_title: Wow....Abysmal
reviews.content: This is my first review on this movie...I feel this strongly on my one-star rating that I feel compelled to write this.I'm not going to go into some long typed monologue on the camera angles and the lighting and the acting, etc. because I don't go see movies to pick them apart, I go to be entertained. This movie was literally, the FIRST movie I've ever watched that if I wasn't with my kids (who were, shamefully to me and my genetic code, enjoying themselves) I would have walked out and demanded my money back.Between the lame one-liners and the terrible CGI effects (I'll explain why later), and the so-so script, it was just too overwhelmingly bad to stick around for.The reason why I say the CGI was bad: If you remember watching old CGI movies where the color of the CGI characters was washed out slightly, making the CGI creatures or men seem like they were not part of the movie...you'll understand why I say horrible. They kind of reminded me of up dated Last Starfighter special effects. In D-War, there were these huge battle scenes, where one army was lined up and you could literally see some of the 3D animated characters "hopping" if you've ever seen bad CGI, I hope you know what I mean.The acting, script and one-liners were on par with Eragon, which is to say, putrescent.Save your money...if you want to see a good "city fighting scene" go rent some old Godzilla flicks...they are more enjoyable than this...at least then, you can laugh at the cheesy special effects rather than the presumably good special effects that are far from.

reviews.review_title: Please go take a walk instead...
reviews.content: One of the worst movies I have seen in years. I was interested in seeing this as well as I was screening it for my kids. However, the over use of unnecessary subtitles, coupled with a horrible storyline made this an abysmal waste of time.Special effects were OK, but in this day and age of CGI and computer animation I would expect no less. Unfortunately as cool as some of the scenes were it couldn't save the acting, storyline, and just overall laughability of this movie.I would probably let my kids watch it only to show them an example of how bad a potentially good movie could have been. Plus I don't think they would make it through the first half hour with all the subtitles. There was very little blood for a violent dragon infested movie so depending on what you are concerned with I do say its fine for my young ones. They have been brought up in a household of online gamers and understand the difference between the real and unreal when its on TV, but people do get eaten and lots are killed, its just not graphic in nature when it happens.

reviews.review_title: Wow, what a roller-coaster ride of quality
reviews.content: How to begin... I have so mixed feelings.When I saw the opening scene, I was like, man, this movie is going to suck big time. It was really, really basic scene, but you could right away tell that the director was no Spielberg. Odly, only 60 seconds from the opening, and we already got into a flashback (which again went to another flashback!), and it got a lot better. What?!? Then came the 'lord of the rings' battle scene, and suddenly it started to look even good. I really liked the 'rocketlauncher lizards', those where cool!But then... then we came back to real-time from the flashbacks, and what a load of crap it brought with it. The movie was as bad as the other reviews say it was. No sense of directing, nor editing. Really bad story telling and acting, and nothing made any sense. I really started to hate this movie, but I kept torturing myself.After an hour of living hell, I thought I would stop the movie and watch something else. It was really that bad. Then it occurred to me that (the movie was still on) I could read some (bad) reviews about it from IMDb just to amuse myself. Not surprised, everyone seemed to hate it.However, on the background something seemed to happen in the movie and it caught my attention. I sat back to the sofa and put my headphones back on. And then... I started to think that this CGI stuff was actually pretty good. The city was been destroyed and cars where flying in the air. Some helicopters where shooting dragons and I was suddenly eating my popcorn again?!? I didn't have a glue what was happening, but that didn't really matter, the action, and especially the CGI was pretty decent. After a while the characters even seemed to jump into another dimension (for some reason) and the CGI was looking really good. What the heck, I started to like this 'what ever they were trying to do' stuff.The end scene with the big fight was really nicely done, and I especially liked when the good(?) snake... I mean dragon, changed into... well, a dragon - a traditional Chinese dragon! I'm a graphic designer, and I must say the CGI was really, really good for the last minutes of the movie. Did you notice how liquid the dragon was when it flew through the air? Very well done.I was totally clueless about the story and everything not related to CGI was horrible. Some stuff was so bad you will tear your eyes out and have nightmares for years, but there was enough tiny things, like the music score and especially the last 15 minutes, that it made me raise my vote from 2 to 7.

reviews.review_title: Take a Real Consideration
reviews.content: I see people leaving comments, bad comments by just reviewing the movie as an actual content. First of all, this movie was not meant for every ages, since when did we as an adult start watching happy feet or transformers? I personally do not want to waste my valuable money to watch these movies with my friends considering my age as 18. However, I do go watch these movies with the KIDS such as my LITTLE BROTHER OR SISTER respecting the fact that the KIDS would like it. Of course a movie like this that was meant for the kids are not gonna satisfy every aspect that we have because of the fact it was meant for the kids. It would have been better to have a strong plot for the adults to enjoy as well, but for the kids, this movie surely do open their eyes and the parents can teach the kids saying how there are all different kinds of movies and cultures out there. I highly do give a credit for a director considering a fact that it must have very hard for him to make a movie like this in U.S. as a first Korean director. Therefore, because I respect the director's effort for the movie and the cultural facts of this movie, I highly recommend this movie to open kids' and your mind.

reviews.review_title: Not that terrible, but don't bother
reviews.content: Here is some good news for the audience who will see 'D-war'. It's not that terrible. It was such honor (or dishonor, whatever you like) to see overblown, disjointed direct-to-video movie projected on huge screen with people around me. However, it was quite depressing 90 minutes. I hate flat, lifeless character-interacting scenes, I was not amused by its cheap humor that evoked very small laughter from audience, and I was at a loss during spectacularly unconvincing and unrealistic finale. In case of CG, the monsters are more or less convincing than hideous monster from 'Deep Rising'. Two attack scenes, good on their own, are just average showcasing of CG without purpose in the movie. The final showdown does not take place in L.A., and I'd rather see that leftover sets and monsters and soldiers from 'The Lord of the Rings' appearing in the middle of smashed L.A.Last year, 'Lady in the Water' introduced outrageous Korean folk tale with not-so-Korean names to U.S. audience. This year, 'D-war' will provide them another one, which is told by literally ubiquitous Robert Forster. I was glad to see Scott Wilson in 'The Host', but Robert Forster in 'D-war'? U.S. critics will probably have the field day with comparing Mr. Forster and Mr. Wilson in their respective movies. It's disheartening to see that Academy award nomination didn't help Mr. Forster's career, and the only consolation is, like Peter O'Toole in 'Phantoms', that Mr. Forster speaks some preposterous lines without laughing. That's the sign of veteran actor who started the career with 'Reflections in a Golden eye' 40 years ago. Anyway, he's still working, so don't worry folks.Speaking of director Hyung-rae Shim, I won't say anything offending to him. He just tried hard to make the film he wanted, and now he gets his wishes. However, he does the most annoying thing I have ever seen on the screen. He seems to think quite seriously of himself and the movie, and, with lame inclusion of 'Arirang' at the end of movie, he shows production pictures with some serious statement. I hope he will never show translated version of it or whatsoever to U.S. critics. They will have gut-busting laugh. It is just like the student who submits lousy report after long, long time with some notes saying 'I tried very, very hard against all odds and this will be my magnum opus. Help me please'. I'm a graduate student who has been as ruthless as Anton Ego to undergraduates about their grade, and big minus point will be guaranteed if I have to grade the one like that.One of the standards of late Gene Siskel is, 'Is this movie better than a documentary of the same actors having lunch?'. Mr. Shim, the answer for your movie is 'NO', and maybe you will have to prepare pretty interesting documentary 'The Making of D-War' for DVD supplement. Or, based on your 'reported' stubbornness and determination, maybe I should ask Roger Ebert about how to make Werner Herzog get interested in you. Maybe you can show Mr. Herzog that you also can move the big steamboat ship to the top of mountain. Maybe Mr. Herzog will get interested and make the documentary about your next big gamble. Now, that's the movie I'd like to see.

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable fantasy action.
reviews.content: I expected mediocre effects for this low budget film, but it turned out to be quite amazing. This was a thoroughly enjoyable fantasy action with some incredible action sequences. Plot flaw: in the beginning of the film the evil Buraki attacks a village in search of the girl born with a dragon-shaped tattoo. If they were hoping to find the girl alive, why did they first bomb the village and then searched for her? The chances were very good they could have killed her during the attack.Nevertheless, the film is a fast-paced joyride of thrilling action and incredible effects. The Atrox Army battle in Los Angeles towards the end is insanely entertaining and well on par with the Hollywood blockbusters.

reviews.review_title: It Takes Two Imoogies To Do A Korean, Horror-Movie Boogie-Woogie
reviews.content: Dragon Wars earned its 5-star rating for seeing to it that - (1) The pretty-haired pretty-boy, actor Jason Behr, as ass-wipe news-reporter, Ethan Kendrik, got (somewhat satisfactorily) roughed up and knocked around and, yes, even got his pretty-hair sufficiently mussed up, too (but not nearly enough for my liking).(2) Los Angeles got royally trashed by both the attacking monster-lizards, along with their allied reptilian friends, as well as by the blundering boys of the U.S. military in their seriously botched attempt at a near-hopeless counter-attack.(3) The final, completely over-the-top showdown that took place between the "good" Imoogi and, yes, the "bad" Imoogi was a real winner. And even though I've grown mighty jaded and blasé about C.G.I. effects, this particular battle-scene between good & bad was exceptionally impressive stuff, if you ask me.Putting all of Dragon Wars' crap aside (and, yes, there was plenty of that), this film actually did more than fulfill its promise when it came to delivering the goods on death and destruction done on a massive scale.And, like, isn't that why people watched this haywire movie? I mean, were viewers really expecting to be entertained by brilliant dialog, and a coherent story, and Oscar-worthy performances? 'Cause I think that only a ding-dong dimwit would've realistically expected that sort of thing from the likes of Dragon Wars.Another one of Dragon Wars' pluses was that, often enough, it was so pathetically stupid that it was actually quite funny. It even got so ludicrous at times that I literally burst out into almost uncontrollable laughter.In some ways I'd actually go so far as to say that Dragon Wars surpassed the likes of Transformers by a Korean, country mile. And, I'd certainly bet you that if this monster-of-a-monster-movie had been directed by, say, Michael Bay, rather than Hyung Rae Shim, then reviewers here on IMDb wouldn't have been so savagely anxious to trash it as they so mercilessly did.Anyways - When it comes to Korean legend, I really can't believe that upon this film's release the people of Korea didn't come forward and publicly protest about how utterly stupid this movie made their beliefs appear to the rest of the world

reviews.review_title: The bitch was useless from start to finish
reviews.content: Overall this wasn't such a bad movie if it was made for television, but I can say the same for 90% of the movies made for this genre.The movie has great CG effects, and I loved the exciting action the director was able to do with combining the CG with surrounding scenery. Clearly this is his strength as a director.The problem is in the continuity of the story. Things just happen suddenly from one scene to the other and it gets worse as the film goes towards the end.First of all what is the purpose of the two protagonists in this movie ? If they were supposed to be the solution, why were they running away though out the entire movie ? There's no clear indication that it was them who called the dragon at the end, so what was their purpose of even being in the movie ? And worse, if they did call the dragon, why were they running, and why did it take so long for them to do what they were supposed to be doing in the first place ? And what was that orb that came out of the girl in the end ? It did absolutely nothing - nothing at all !So this bitch who was supposed to be the main focus of the story did absolutely nothing from beginning to the end. The story ended because of some miraculous act of nature as far as I can tell.And one last thing - why did the snake thing take so long to kill the bitch ? It had at least three scenes that it could have finished her off in half a second. When it comes to the time of doing the honors, it just pauses and slithers around until something else happens.Go for the action and not the story on this one. CG is good, and the battle is pretty exciting, so it's worth watching if you like giant reptile movies.

reviews.review_title: Dragon Wars could possibly be the worst movie of our generation.
reviews.content: For those who have seen it, most agree. This movie sucked beyond belief. I will begin by listing contextual reasons why this movie was unbearable to even sit through.(1)At the very start, the characters call the dragons "Iwugi." This gets very annoying, VERY fast. They should seriously call them dragons, like the title declares. (2)The evil Iwugi NEVER EATS ANYTHING! Even the elephant it picks up at the zoo, it just flings it at the fat night guard. Most of the time it just stares at its prey, waiting for it to run again. (3)Most of the scenes are random as hell. At one point the president is escorting these 2 kids to wherever. Yes, the PRESIDENT. Then they enter a random warehouse and the president pulls a gun on the girl and says, "I've done my homework, it's the only way." Yes, the PRESIDENT. Cliché-ly he gets shot as he is about to pull the trigger by his assistant, whom you never see for the remainder of the film. You will walk out of the theater asking, "what the hell happened in the past 2 hours?" Plot flow was anything but smooth. (4)Acting was terrible. Characters barely show any emotions and say/ do things, yes, you guessed it, randomly. After they barely escape a given dragon fight, you find the main guy and girl on the beach, and they kiss. Soon after they love each other eternally. Wait, back up...they just met?? (5)The ending finally shows the title: Dragon Wars. The good and evil Iwugis fight in a surprisingly yawning battle. Totally out of the f'n randomness, the main female character gives her soul up to the good dragon and it becomes empowered and defeats the evil Iwugi. Then the good Iwugi flies up to heaven, and his girlfriend is dead. If you cared to even notice at this point, the main character is left alone in a demonic wasteland. How the hell is he going to get out? Where is he?! HORRIBLE FILM DON'T EVEN WASTE A BUCK AT THE LOCAL $1 THEATER 3 MONTHS LATER. IT'S NOT WORTH IT. I PAID REGULAR ADMISSION TO WARN THE PUBLIC ABOUT THIS MOVIE! (Don't even go to laugh at it, because you won't even laugh, you will be just in awe of how lame it is.)

reviews.review_title: Terrible Acting, Terrible Story Line, Excellent Graphics & Special Effects--Not Worth It
reviews.content: First of all, the actors did a terrible job. In the beginning when it flashes back to 500 years earlier, the last time the evil serpent attacked, it shows him and his followers destroying an entire village looking for the young girl. Where is the good serpent during this time? Twiddling his thumbs while these people are being annihilated? He's a heavenly serpent, yet he doesn't protect the people? Another thing, the movie has no business being named Dragon Wars. There is only ONE instance of dragons fighting in this movie, and that's at the very end. When this good serpent finally does show up, he is incapacitated after only a short time of fighting.The characters are naive and simple-minded. Throughout the entire movie, hundreds of people are being slaughtered and the entire city is being destroyed, and this Ethan guy only cares about saving his precious Sarah. His only idea to save the world or Sarah is to "just keep running". Apparently he can't get it through his head that this army chasing them has the ability to destroy everything,what makes him think he can escape? The evil serpent catches up to Ethan and Sarah several times, yet when he does, he just kind of growls at them. He eventually gets distracted and, alas, they escape again. It would appear the the evil serpent never did have the ability to take the Yeouijoo from Sarah, because in the end she releases it and gives it to the good serpent...The story line is too simple, and therefore this movie was unable to retain my attention for very long. The only evidence that any effort was put into this movie is the Computer Animation used, which is very nice. All of the good parts in this movie could be cut and compiled into a 20 minute trailer, because the only parts worth watching are the fight scenes.

reviews.review_title: And I thought Transformers had a weak story....
reviews.content: I hate to even waste the time it takes to write 10 lines on this atrocity. Hyung-Rae Shim is lucky that bad film-making isn't a capital crime or he'd be put to death twice for writing and directing this disaster. I'm amazed that this film had a $75m budget, but actually glad in the sense that it was such a tremendous flop, that Shim will hopefully, never get to make another movie the rest of the life and, therefore, not waste any more of filmgoers time. I would think the actors would have gotten together and lynched him by now.With the effects resources available to them, a great film could have been made with this budget. As usual, the failure should have been spotted at the very beginning with the terrible script and story. "Transformers" was another visual feast with a weak script, but this makes it look like "Citizen Kane".

reviews.review_title: Transformers, With Pre-Historic Creatures!
reviews.content: Based on the Korean legend, unknown creatures will return and devastate the planet. Reporter Ethan Kendrick is called in to investigate the matter, and he arrives at the conclusion that a girl, stricken with a mysterious illness, named Sarah is suppose to help him. The Imoogi makes its way to Los Angeles, wreaking havoc and destruction. With the entire city under arms, will Ethan and Sarah make it in time to save the people of Los Angeles?If you want to see this film, it's because you want some cheesy fun. What I can tell you now is that this film delivers it. It delivers tons of it. It delivers so much, you will get tired of it. I would say this movie is split into 3 parts: The first 20 minutes is the origin of the story, the next 50 minutes is basically a chase movie, and the last 30 minutes is non-stop action.If that sounds good for you, watch it. If you are seriously looking for a serious film that has a good plot line, don't watch it. I can tell you now, the story is laughably bad. The whole movie is unintentionally funny but is also very funny with its gags. So what you get from this movie is 90 minutes of non-stop unintentional with some intentional laughs with action!Now, usually, I say, "Ignore how stupid the plot is; just go with it." In this case, I couldn't do that. The story is just so very bad...it fun to laugh at it, but not to go along with it as much so that you could enjoy the movie. For the special effects, they are undeniably great and the action scenes are visually extensive.There's no doubt if you want to have a fun time, you will. There's no doubt that you'll laugh at almost everything in this movie. There's no doubt that the action was great. Overall, if you liked what I've just described to you in this following review, watch it!
