reviews.review_title: Should have been better
reviews.content: OK, Others will have said it better but depending on your age, you will either really enjoy this film, or find it very tedious and disappointing. I would put myself in the latter category. I'll admit the CGI was pretty good, but it came across as a bit tame considering how strong these creatures are supposed to be. The acting was a bit odd, (no, let's make that dull, and wooden) the villains came across as Power Rangeresque and just about as intelligent. Could this have been better? Yes, of course. A brief explanation at the beginning of the film (5 minutes tops) giving the legend and destiny of those involved would have saved a lot of dull bits in the film. Faster cuts in places would have helped in others. That being said, kids will probably like the action, and will most likely overlook the acting. Adults, might find it something to get through (if watching with kids) and then move on to something better.

reviews.review_title: Great Children's Fantasy. I'd Give It A Nine But That's Probably Over-Doing It
reviews.content: this is such a great kid's flick. there is so much youthful innocence and wholesomeness here that parents have little or nothing to worry about. sure there are deaths and violence and a dragon does munch on a couple of youthful lovers by a swimming pool, but there is no actual bloodshed and nothing is graphic. there is also no sex or profanity in this film either. your kid's are not going to be subjected to constant "F" bomb drops or exposed to a whole new vocabulary of naughty language.not to mention the dragons are cute. the dragons do cute things like pick up cars in their mouths and throw them at people, chase each other's tails, and smash up buildings in LA. if i was a dragon i would probably want to do that stuff too. especially when they step on people or whack helicopters with their tails.even though this film doesn't have much of a rep i think that's a little unfair. not only is it a whimsical fantasy, but it boast really good production design and dragon design and it's FX are ahead of things for the time period and for a medium budgeted matinée movie like this. the scene of the dragon wrapped around the skyscraper building is reminiscent of B movie classics like 'Q' and 'The Giant Claw'. this movie really is an exception for what it is.this is a great film to get for the kids. it's magical and whimsical, and it has very little that is offensive about it. it also has more appeal for very small children then, say, something a little more involved and drawn out like 'Avatar' or 'Lord of the Rings'.there isn't a whole lot to ponder here except magical whimsy and fun. anyone expecting anything too pompous or serious will have quibble with this. all that's required is a love of dragon folklore and of their lovable, mythical, magical, mystery.

reviews.review_title: Too much fate, not enough sense
reviews.content: Korean movie with Western cast? All right, but it means it is still Korean movie - incomprehensible, with strong sense of self importance. The story might have some sense if you have PhD in Korean cultural science - but for a common viewer it is just constant flow of screams like "It must be done, because it is our FATE." "I have not asked for this FATE." "The FATE can be changed." "We should be grateful for this FATE." Very well, Korean folks. The concept of "fate" might play important role in your society but it has very little role in Western tradition and definitely not this way. (In Western tradition every individual may have his individual fate - like Oidipus. But there is nothing like "historical fate" based on 1000 years old happenings for an individual. In Western tradition there is concept of "free will" way more prevalent. In non-reincarnation cultures the "historical fate" has no sense at all.) In the end we have C-class love story, short and unimaginative warfare scenes and bizarre fantasy army which destroys tanks and helicopters, because is probably made from pure magic (or whatever). Stupid story slowly descends into pure and absolutely incomprehensible chaos. The ending is probably from a completely different story, I guess some Korean fairy-tale. For me, an culturally not prepared common viewer, the ending simply does not exist. The story just ends somewhat and there are titles running. What has happened? What has happened to common folks on Earth? Was the ending good? Was the ending bad? Was it somewhat important? I really have no idea.Please save some time of yours and skip this movie. Watch the "Moby Dick" instead - the story is moralistic, somewhat slow, but way better than this.

reviews.review_title: D-Wars: Winner of Worst and Most Stupid Possible Movie Ever
reviews.content: This movie was honestly, by far, the worst movie ever made. Was it not for the hope of seeing the ending credits, I wouldn't have made it through this crap fest. Why did this movie make me want to raise money for starting a foundation with the sole purpose of keeping people away from "Dragon Wars: D-Wars"? --the acting, except for that guy from The Office, would have been better if done by a group of cardboard cutouts --the plot holes: 1) during the painful flashback at the beginning where the grandfather is talking to the kid and showing him the map, the camera zooms in on the map, goes back to the grandfather, and the map has disappeared. 2) THE MAIN CHARACTER IS SHOT, DOES NOT BLEED, AND WALKS AWAY as I am waiting for him to die, which he never does even though he was shot in the chest..there isn't even a mark on him!?!? --After the romantic statement: "We have to get you some real clothes" the two of them kiss even though they just met each other 20 minutes earlier and there hasn't even been a hint that they were attracted to each other --in the end, the guy is in f****** Mordor and just starts walking away. Where the hell was he going? --I swear to God the Blue Power Ranger actually appeared when the dragons were attacking that Korean town --They were the reincarnation of the Korean legend people? What the hell? --The action was completely over-the-top stupid. Everybody just shooting everywhere, no blood, and then the Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon spinning fighting that looked extremely and ridiculously stupid. --The huge Pokémon-looking turtles with the rockets on their backs. How did they even fire them? --the plot was extremely stupid, nothing made sense, extreme waste of money, painful to watch, stupid, bad, horrid, stupid...What does this all mean? This movie deserved a negative rating. As in, I would rather be kicked in the balls for two straight hours than watch it again. DO NOT EVER EVER WATCH EVEN A TRAILER FOR THIS MOVIE, IT IS THAT BAD

reviews.review_title: Lets be fair, you don't go into D-War thinking Citizen Kane
reviews.content: Compared to Shim's previous outing, we have a gigantic leap forward in every way imaginable. And if compared to a lot of the horrible monster films of the 60s, 70s and 90s which some people give so much credit to, D-War is by far a disappointing mess.The story, in my view wasn't bad at all, at least the prologue . We start with Ethan Kendrick (Cody Arens) and his father at an antique shop trying to sell a dagger to Jack (Robert Forster), who pretends to have a heart attack to talk to Ethan alone about the story of his destiny. Forster narrates the story well I thought, he tells of a good and a bad Imoogi (Korean dragons) who become celestial dragons if a girl with a certain mark on her shoulder, that appears every 500 years, is sacrificed to them, called Yeo-Yi-Joo. In 1507 Korea, the girl is born and a wizard/shaman named Bochun and his ward Haram are entrusted to protect her till her 18 or 20 birthday, which is when her power is activated. The bad Imoogi, Buraki and his Artox army (you heard right, ARTOX army) ravage the village or kingdom in search of her. However Haram and Yeo-Yi-Joo have fallen in love, being her life long protector, which we are assured by Forster should surprise no one (except apparently him and the king who ordered the whole mess together). as they flee for there lives rather than sacrifice her to the good Imoogi, Buraki chases them to a cliff, and rather than die by him, they jump, and die "as star-crossed lovers". Ethan is the re-incarnation of Haram, Jack of Bochun and an unknown girl which he must find (Sarah) who is Yeo-Yi-Joo, as the time for a new dragon war nears.Now that prologue is fine in my view, and had the film been about Haram and Yeo-Yi-Joo falling in love vs. following there proscribed destinies, an exploration of the strict caste systems of Feudalism vs. there ever growing tenderness, about Yeo-Yi-Joo's father (the King) and his grief at the death of his wife and the curse of his child, playing up the star-crossed lovers angle, and of course Giant snake fights and Artox armies with feudal age missiles, than this would have gone far and beyond the standard giant monster film, and even a very good film in general. But that would take a director with more talent (though something can be said for his work on action scenes) and a bit more courage to film for the sake of art rather than to score bank in the States (which is why the majority of the film is with American actors), and we have to have a reason for the snake and the Artox general to fight and chase Sarah and Ethan all over LA.Now from that statement you would get the notion that this is a terrible film, which it is, but it is because of things rather than despite (which I know is only different in how you organize a sentence but I think I can make a case for a bigger differentiation) , its horrible acting rather than despite good acting makes things easier to forgive, because it means there is some untainted qualities to like about a film. If you tell your friend "the movie would have been great if it wasn't for the..." it means there was something there to enjoy, but if you say "even though it had (insert positive remark) it sucked" it means whatever good quality it had was nullified by something overlapping and worse.By far the worst aspect, was the acting, which makes sense, Shim's not a great director, and like anyone who isn't bi-lingual in said languages you cant really tell if what your actors are saying came off as over-the-top, cheesy, slurred, awkward and like Nick Adams in "Invasion of Astro-Monster" your likely to be directed into hamming it up pretty strong. The second nail is the plot after Forster finishes talking, it goes nowhere and fast, it pretty much boils down to excuses for the snake to chase from location to location smashing things. By this point plots are pointless and intrusive, but they intrude anyway with revelations which add nothing, a love story which is anti-compelling, and federal officers running about for a quasi sub plot that goes nowhere in an anti climactic anything-but-tense moment in an empty garage. Altogether, considering the type of film and the obvious state of mind you go to these movies for, you'll hate part of it, the subordinate part (story, plot, human characters, any attempts at blossoming relationships) and love the rest (the dragons, battles, the inevitable monster clash winner-take-all ending to save the world).There is one thing that can be said for Shim, his determination to make quality CGI without Hollywood, entirely in Korea. I think in years to come Korea will thank the work done here by Younggu-Art's for making Korean action/fantasy films able to compete with America, Britain and Japan, and they might very well become a sort of Asian Pixar out of there achievements here.This is the kind of film you watch with your friends, pointing out the plot holes like hidden message Easter eggs (of which there is no short supply) and being dumb founded by some of the more impossible leaps of even fictional faith and the least convincing effects (the dead elephant, the entire bridge scene). The kind of film you hope to be pleasantly surprised by or nostalgia with quality explosions. The more I've seen it and thought about it the more my disdain for the worst parts turn into welcomed additions. The kind of film you go into shouting "D-War! woo!".A sincere 7 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Dino-Riders with Shoulder Missiles
reviews.content: This is one the worst movies I have ever seen. It is ridiculously bad. The CG is amateurish. The storyline is very disjointed. You thought this movie was about dragons fighting? No, the majority of the action is dragon-esquire creatures fighting helicopters. For shame. It isn't like I expected realism or anything; but, man...It is so bad. At the beginning of this story there is this flash back which basically states that the main characters are reincarnated lovers who have waited 500 years to be together. Well, funny thing is they never get to be together. On top of that, the main character's pawn shop-owning buddy/mentor is the mentor/teacher of him in his first life. Nice. Oh, people fly and shoot fireballs in this movie... There are also lizard-dino-riders with mechanical shoulder missiles in ancient China.

reviews.review_title: Save your money!

The only thing that kept my husband I from walking out of the theater was that we, and the people around us, took great amusement in heckling the movie as we were watching it. The CGI was even totally missing from one of the main scenes! How could that have slipped through? There were elements of the action scenes that did not fit together. The whole thing reeks of being hastily written and planned.It was a waste of money and time.

reviews.content: We seriously need a negative rating system, this was by far the most horrible movie I have EVER, EVER did I mention EVER seen, let me put it to you this way I created a IMDb account JUST to write this review and tell you guys what a absolutely HORRIBLE movie this was, the ONLY thing this movie was good for was the CGI animation other then that the story was pathetic, the acting as someone said before 1 step above a BAD 70's porno, the incoherent storyline and retarded scenes made me laugh actually, so maybe it doesn't deserve a 1 (nah it does) I love it they are being chased by a giant snake and they stop on the beach and kiss ha ha, and I love how nonchalant half the actors behave to what is supposedly going on, well this film actually made got to me, it brought tears to my eyes, not because of joy, but of pain I had to slap myself several times for even wanting to see it in the 1st place, omg I can go on and on but I need to go jump out my window now..

reviews.review_title: One thing about Fury Overlord's comment below
reviews.content: Although I agree mostly with Fury Overlord's comments below(I too, as a Korean, think that it's totally absurd that this film is getting this kind of blind support), there's one misinformation he seems to have so I'd like to correct it. Most of the CGs in the past Korean films has been done in Korea as well. Korean CG making is not at a very low level, they have quite a lot of demand and experience due to the prosperity of online game-making and film-making. Of course nowhere near at Hollywood level mainly due to much lower funding, but not that bad either. What separates this film and the previous ones were that MUCH more money and effort was invested to CG(there were hardly any films before in Korea that had used CG anywhere as much as this one), and that's what made some fanatics of this film think it is something revolutionary(for Korea that is). But again, I think they should realize that being revolutionary in Korea hardly means anything to the world.My advice: Watch this only if you plan to see it with your kids.

reviews.review_title: Spectacular special effects and absolutely nothing else
reviews.content: The special effects are simply breathtaking, with monsters of old fighting modern military units in the streets of a major city. They must have demolished a thousand cars making this, but the action scenes are extremely well put together. Even the dragon fight is well done, certainly better than the average monster, even in recent times.It would have been a far better movie if they had just cut everything else out and tossed it in the trash. The plot is broad brush simplistic but confusing in detail. I just gave up trying to figure out the subtlety. There were good creatures and bad creatures. Sometimes you could tell them apart. End of discussion.The leads were horrible actors, and for that matter so was just about everybody with a human face. The evil warriors were great, as was the evil general or whatever he was supposed to be, grunting guttural epithets behind a mask.I hope to see the special effects team in future productions. I'd pay just to see the fights. And pay extra if they dumped the rest of the movie in the trash.

reviews.review_title: Poor film but awesome soundtrack
reviews.content: This film is lucky to have a 3.6 rating but it's not a complete turkey due to Steve Jablonsky's beautiful score. This is a far better movie score than the film deserves and here's the great part, the soundtrack album is a thing of beauty in its own right. I play the album a lot it is that good.Yuna Kim, 2010 Olympic champion, skated a routine using the track Arirang, from the D-War score, it is that highly regarded.

Yea i said made me cry. I was crying because i spent 7.50 on a very bad film. I was reminded of the old Godzilla films , the acting was at about that level. CG could not save this film, as far as that go's nothing could save this film. Bad story line, bad acting and not very impressive CG. The story line jumped around and gave you no real feel for this movie. The actors were second rate on all counts and would have been better with Japanese actors wit sub titles or at least equal. CG had many mistakes in it, they tried to use the blur effect to demonstrate fast moving animation and it just made my eyes hurt. Don't go pay for this very poorly done and obviously rushed film. I think it will be on video in the next month or so. In the bargain bin in 3 months, not that it will justify a rental or even a 1.99 purchase. It might have made a good anime cartoon, but not a movie. You will feel riped off if money leaves your pocket for this one.

reviews.review_title: Could have been better
reviews.content: People commenting about cgi fest while loving mcu are just dumb hypocrites.Cool design for the dragons - looks even better than 2021 shang shi.But the story is told like a mess.Good actors int their own right. But no good structure.

reviews.review_title: a disappointment
reviews.content: wow ... this movie was ridiculous. Nothing made sense. The CGI did nothing for me. The dragons didn't even look like dragons..they were like giant snakes. The acting sucked. Strangely some parts of the movie reminded me of the Lord of the Rings. There was one part of the movie that made me laugh though. It was so stupid that I had to laugh. It was when the old women walks into the wall thinking she can because she saw some random guy do it..pretty stupid. This movie deff. could've been so much better. I could've made a better movie!.... I don't recommend Dragon Wars... only watch it if you want to see the epitome of a bad movie 'Across the universe' and into my heart <3

reviews.review_title: Better than Reign of Fire
reviews.content: Poking fun at this film is about as sporting as bashing Showgirls or Battlefield Earth. Finding out it was a Korean film cleared up a lot of mysteries. I thought the film really respected our intelligence by expecting us to understand Korean, but they must have just forgotten to dub in dialog or enter subtitles. Why exactly heroes from 1507 Korea would be reincarnated in Los Angeles is never cleared up. Nor is it clear why they would all be reincarnated in the same vicinity and period. Apparently there's a batch mode.I watched this film on line after seeing a mention of the special effects, and they are indeed impressive. The problem I had with Reign of Fire was I wanted to see the battle, not the post-apocalyptic aftermath. You get the battle here. Big lumbering beasts of burden are reminiscent of the Gungan beasts in Phantom Menace, and some of the attack bugs in Starship Troopers. And as many reviewers note, the finale takes place in Mordor.The thing is, with about fifteen more minutes for decent plot transitions, continuity and hole filling, this could actually have been a pretty decent film. And for heaven's sake, give us some subtitles.

reviews.review_title: Listed 15 other great Korean movies. Please don't compare those with D-War.
reviews.content: OK.. First of all, I am Korean and I have to say... this movie is pretty bad which makes it entertaining. I give 6 here. 1 for supporting the korean movie industry. 1 for graphic. 1 for action. 3 for unintentionally funny moments. This movie had potential to be great. Story-line, graphic, action scene were there. What was missing was a good script and acting. Script was cheesy and acting was soo horrible. It has funny moment here and there. Well, I have thing for the bad movie. It's unintentionally funny because it's so bad. You know what I am getting at? Anyways... I read some of the comments and it's not a Chinese legend. It's Koreans'. Don't confuse those. Oh... There were some ridiculous things through out the movie. I don't know why there were cannons mounted on those creatures. Also, I don't know why the hell there were an army of dark. They were sure not in the legend. I don't know why the director decided to put in the mythical lord of ring-ish creatures in there. Anyways... if you seat through the whole movie, it isn't that bad. Acting and script is soo bad it's funny. However, action and graphic makes up for it. If you like bad movie, go watch it. If you have kids, go watch it since I think it's targeted to more to kids. Otherwise, just wait until it comes out in the blockbuster or dollar theater. reviews.review_title: Bad bad bad bad bad
reviews.content: After all thing things that was said about this film i can only really see one good thing about it..... it had an ending. The plot had no proper direction. the character development was poor and the character chemistry just as bad. reviews.review_title: Worth watching...
reviews.content: Based on reading the other reviews for this, and the 3.8 (current) rating -- I prepared myself for the worst. But I enjoyed it -- I mean it was a 'sweet' way to spend a couple of hours while I was taking a rest from work.In fact... the worst waste of my time was wading my way through the deluge of people parroting on about how the movie was riddled with holes like a piece of swiss cheese.If you can manage to relax and save the analysis for Casablanca, 12 Angry Men, or Rear Window -- then please rent the DVD and ... take it easy. Otherwise, grab yourself a copy of 'The Jane Austen Book Club' -- it seems like it's more your style.

reviews.review_title: Dream within a Dream
reviews.content: In that I mean a flashback within a flashback are you serious? That was so confusing! It was like they couldn't find a better way to integrate the back story into the main plot without the use of flashbacks. (The Jason Bourne series did this well but this is no Jason Bourne).Which by the way took up a good first portion of the movie. Second there were way too many things that went unexplained.Like how the bad guy, the girl with the mark, the boy who protects her, and his mentor can all come back via reincarnate, that should have been explained for people not familiar with the concept and the mythology that surrounds it. Than when the guy gets knocked out and then wakes up in some medieval castle like area it's like OK and where exactly is this place? Than he gets ready to escape with the girl, I'm all like dude how do you know where to go idiot? You were knocked out when got you there. Do you even know what continent you're on?How is it no one noticed this big castle in this day in age? How was the bad guy able to raise an entire army from the scrolls found laying casually around in the shopkeep's store? If they were that powerful why didn't he protect them better? I could go on and on here as far as unanswered questions I mean plot holes are abound in this thing.I'll leave with this, why would a father for $1,000 leave his son alone with a storekeep that he doesn't know to travel only God knows how far to some store to tell another storekeep something so he could get the money. Granted in the movie the storekeep is telling the boy a story (whilst he's gotta him all alone) about serpents but at anytime he could've been like and now little Timmy I must show you the most powerful serpent of them all and just whipped it out! Not cool I know there had to be many parents in the theater going NOOOOOOO! DAD YOU DO NOT DO THAT!This movie did have excellent cgi and fx but that wasn't nearly enough to overcome this daft and ghastly story!

reviews.review_title: Not just a waste of 2 hours of my life...
reviews.content: Normally, I'll say "Well, there's 2 hours of my life I'll never get back..." and go on about my business. Not this time, my friends. I am going out of my way to write scathing reviews on multiple movie sites today (even though professional critics have ripped it, I'm still going to review it). Dragon Wars did not have good CG; go onto a Peer-2-Peer file sharing community and find some 5 minute short animations that have no point and are free/legal for trading and you will see some good CG that serves no other purpose than to get that creator's name out into the world and they far surpass what "D-War" has put out. Here, I'll shorten this up a bit by saying "D-War" was likely created by some people with a little extra money to spend and WAY too much time on their hands that had heard some legend or just an old dragon story somewhere and thought they'd make a movie out of it. I couldn't get online last night and had nothing else to watch, otherwise I would have stopped. Now that I have thrown this 2 hours of my life away into limbo, I hope I can spare you the same fate. Let me go so far as to argue against other user reviews: this movie is not a good kids movie, not a casual adult movie, and it was not "something to blow time on a rainy Saturday." Read a book on you rainy Sat. before you bother watching this travesty of a film. Do yourself a favor and stare at a piece of popcorn on your ceiling, it would be time better spent.

reviews.review_title: Good Dragon wins, girl dies. plus crying dragons
reviews.content: So every 500 years the Bukai try to get the Yu Yi Ju to become a real Dragon, or something. But it doesn't. So in 2007 it tries again and gets really close but still doesn't get it. In the final D- War the good dragon and the bad dragon fight and the bad dragon loses. It swallowed a fireball and died. The main girl dies too. Darrell from the Office is in it. The Dragons evolve from serpents and so the main bad Dragon is still a serpent because he hasn't obtained the Yu Yi JU. He tries hard. Very Hard. The main girl has the Yu YI Ju in her, but it really comes down from heaven on he 20th birthday. When that happens she dies. The main dude get sad but he gets better by the end. This also make the good dragon sad and it cries. More than a dragon should cry, but I guess they were pretty close. Overall a quality movie.

reviews.review_title: Why do I even bother?
reviews.content: Seriously....why do I even bother thinking that some movies are worth the money? This movie is worthless. It is...it's just bad. The special effects for the dragons is just something you would laugh at. The plot is stupid as it is! The only good thing about it was that the girl was as fit as hell. I don't recommend it to anyone...in fact I recommend that people don't recommend this movie! The action in this movie is just...oh god it's horrible. I highly recommend to anyone that they pass up watching this movie. This movie is a horror...not the genre horror but literally, this movie is actually a horror to watch. Do NOT watch this film. Bad acting, bad effects, bad plot...bad everything. 2/10 (the 2 is for the fit girl)

reviews.review_title: In the right context you understand. wow.
reviews.content: First and foremost, this movie was god awful.  For all of those people who have an attention span of a gnat I recommend skipping out on this particular movie.  The only half way decent part of this flick would be the special effects of the creatures/especially the dragons.  Now for the downside.  The storyline was horrible.  The cast terrible.  Let me elaborate.  How many movies can Hollywood possibly make that start with an ancient Chinese legend coming to life, and destroying everything unless either a girl or relic is kept unharmed?  Oh well, let's make another movie about it, maybe this one will sell.  I am going to cut this review short on account of prematurely erasing this movie from my right temporal lobe.  If you are contemplating whether or not to rent/buy this movie, go buy warriors of virtue.

reviews.review_title: Very disappointing
reviews.content: I was quite excited to see this movie when I watched the trailer. I am a huge fan of dragons, so I couldn't wait. Sadly the trailer makes the movie look 10 times better than the film actually is.The acting in this movie is terrible, the actors seem uncaring. The dialogues are cheesy and downright ridiculous at certain points. The story skips over many details. The cuts from one group of people to another is annoying, and slightly confusing at times.The only thing that makes this movie deserve a rating of 4 out of 10 is the CGI. The CGI in this movie is phenomenal. For an extremely brief moment you can lose yourself in the beauty of the creatures, until you are forced back into reality by the sheer cheesiness of some scenes.

reviews.review_title: Worst Movie I have ever seen!
reviews.content: I have seen many a bad movie in my day and usually laugh at how bad they are. This movie is the first movie where i actually was getting mad at not only myself for seeing it but at who in there right mind gave people the money to make this. The script was horrible, the acting was horrible, the direction was horrible. The only redeeming quality of this movie is the effects of the Dragons were good. Every single second of this movie seem to give me more and more pain. I really wanted to give it a chance and i was trying to the whole time only to be let down extremely painfully each time. I would give this movie about half of a star because the effects and some of it was good for a laugh with friends, but if you want to see what is wrong with the entire movie industry see this film!!!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as it's made out to be
reviews.content: Okay, I know this is no where near the best movie of the year. But then, it's not intended to be. It's just supposed to be a movie to watch when you have nothing better to do or if you want to waste time. Just a movie to watch to have fun with the effects and the action, kind of like Ghost Rider.THe acting wasn't the best I've ever seen, (by a long shot) but i guess the excuse for that and for the script is that all the character development happened 500 years ago with their previous selves. This is the movie you watch to see the armies of otherworldly soldiers attacking the city, and the clash between the giant snakes and eventually the dragon. I'll admit, they kept the dragon within Chinese (or Korean as it may be) design and really accurate.

reviews.review_title: Worse acting ever
reviews.content: Maybe the terrible acting was actually better than the incoherent plot. Whatever it was. Just a bad movie. Possibly the worse acting by an entire cast, ever, outside of a home video. No, upon further reflection I'm wrong, the writers could be the least able members of this debacle. I wonder what elementary school they currently attend.So many stupid things were said or done during this movie, it would be impossible to recount them all. It sure looked like the "evil" dragon won the last battle. I hope so, I ended up pulling for the evil forces to eliminate every other actor on the set. The leading male actor was beyond bad. The leading female actress should put her USC cheerleader outfit back on and go yell at something.Does anybody really know what this movie was about???

reviews.review_title: It's the most horrible movie I have ever seen !
reviews.content: I have never seen a movie this bad. OK, so it has great special effects, but the story line does not make any sense ! I hate to say it, it is an insult to my intelligence watching this movie. I just want to forget it. it annoyed me. If they want to get credit for the special effects, just make the whole movie full with special effects without any story line at all. At least that would be better and more entertaining. Where did all those creatures suddenly appear from ? With all those creatures lurking around the city, those people still sitting enjoying their cups of coffee and didn't even panic until later ? If something big like that happened, why would those people in the news room look as if they were doing business as usual? How were those missile launchers conveniently installed on the back of those supposedly ancient creatures again ? Just so many things that did not make sense ! I am glad I watched it on a borrowed DVD from a friend. Would hate spending my money on it ! brrr...horrible horrible horrible ! It leaves an impression alright ! One that you perhaps never get even from B grade movies. I have never bothered to write any comment on any movie, but this one...I just had to, for the sake of humanity I guess.

reviews.review_title: should of been named dragon playground scraps
reviews.content: My expectations for this film were quiet high , the visuals are stunning , but i wish i could say the same about the movie , it was stupid and as if it was written by a 12 year old in one scene a an gets shot in the stomach and it mildly hurts him he gets up with no bullet wounds and doesn't same to be in any pain. In my own opinion i think the fighting scenes were just awful i know this film is based for kids but they could of at least made it look like they were hitting each other.Another problem i had was how the dragon keeps chasing them youl find that about 80 % of the movie is the dragon chasing him dragon loosing him dragon chasing him dragon loosing him dragon chasing him dragon loosing him how many times can a dragon lose a car ? and the ending well i wont spoil it for you as if there was anything to spoil but if you were hoping the a epic battle at the end you are far of

reviews.review_title: The best of Sci-Fi channel premiers!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: Just saw this last night on Sci-Fi channel, and compared to the other Sci-Fi premiers me and my dad sit through, this certainly excelled! The acting was a pretty bad and the story and plot were quite weak as I fully expected, and all the other elements of a great movie, ie. plot, back story, believability, character development , character chemistry... were pretty much weak, but there was genuine heart and effort in this movie, great potential too, and if this was picked up by a better director and actual writers then this would easily start a cult trilogy with a lot of fans. The aforementioned weak story and other things i said were still there and the problems everybody seems to have with it seem to stem from their expectations, when they saw it, they expected to see a masterpiece, when I saw it, I just wanted it not to suck, or they saw it in theaters and paid to see it, boy, that would've sucked badly and I sympathize! I caught this basically for free on satellite, so my expectations were low, I didn't lose much other than an hour or so from my hectic life, and I got to spend that time with my dad, so my experience was totally different from others and I and my dad were quite pleased.All in all this movie's great if you aren't expecting more than a relaxing hour or so, don't pay money, or sit in a dusty movie theater seat. This movie is what is; a joyful, lighthearted escape from reality with some great action, impressive cgi, and a pretty leading lady... can't act, but she is cute!

reviews.review_title: This iz one of my best childhood movie
reviews.content: I don't care what others say coz this movie is one of best movie when I was kid i always say need to see d war wow now I need to download again to kNow how good this movie was 😍😍😍😍

reviews.review_title: Well, it was very bad...
reviews.content: Well, I just wasted some time seeing this and I bet everything is said about it. But, was it just me that was thinking about Godzilla, when the choppers were flying around cloud-scrapers and were shooting? The things that disturbed me mostly were the military actions in the movie. Like when, time and again the U.S well-trained apache pilots is just about to crash. Instead of trying to avoid the upcoming danger he takes his hands over his head to protect himself. If you really have time to put your arms...Some other stuff: Who was the genius that put a swat-team up on a 300 meter high building, to fire down at enemies with their what, MP40's? Or did I see wrong? A pilot shots two missiles that tracks a small dragon and kills it, can you really lock on target on something that isn't made of metal? Even worse, at a time, some other swat-team runs into a cave led by this waving captain, following him closely like a bunch of school kids running into Mc'Donalds. They stop and scream like children and run out. What exactly did they expect to find inside the cave? At another scene there is a pilot who shots at a small flying dragon with his small revolver, shooting through his own windshield? And the doctor, who makes this hypnosis, is he actually talking to her while she is asleep? Or did I misunderstand? If U.S could get tanks into the city, why on earth didn't they get warplanes or bomb-planes or anything, effective since the enemy was walking on a straight line.I just love the classic pilot radio line, "I can't see them." when there are like 200 dragons flying all over the city.I believe the main character being shot and keeps on like nothing, is already written about, and the paper-thin love-story.Well thanks if you read it, my first time writing here. I hope there were no misunderstandings with the English =).Regards Robin,

reviews.review_title: Waste of time.
reviews.content: Only reason I gave this 3 stars is for the semi decent action/special effects sequences. As for the plot and rest of the movie, you spend the whole time watching a snake chase a girl its supposed to eat. The thing can plow through buildings, toss vehicles like confetti, but as soon as it gets within inches of the girl, it somehow thinks staring at her and roaring loudly is the equivalent of eating her. Just when it looks like it might have a brain cell that's working, the army or cops show up and start shooting at it. This is probably similar to spitting paper wads from straws, as the thing can have a building fall on top of it and literally go unscathed. As you can imagine by now, instead of enjoying an action packed movie, you spend the entire time throwing your hands in the air, thinking how stupid the plot is or how much effort was put into it and wondering how no one thought it was a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: huh? how did this movie get a significant amount of vote of 10/10?
reviews.content: my guess is that about 80% of that vote would be the koreans who will pride in their nation's work no matter how bad it is. No offense, im a korean too, and i saw this in a korean movie theater the day it came out with some of my U.S born korean friends. While all three of us couldn't wait for the movie to be over, (and when it finally was, we stormed out to get something to eat) we could hear clapping, whispers of praise from the audience behind us.i've given a 1 outta 10 for the following reasons 1. i truly believe that's what the movie is worth... at MOST 2. to counter-balance all the people that gave 10 outta 10, not based on the quality of the movie but for the face that it came from their country 3. Made me waste $6, 1-2 hours of time in Korea during summer break"The Host", "Old boy" are both korean movies that are A lot better than this.And to respond to some of the comments given on this movie saying it reached an overwhelming record of views in Korea, it was because this movie was advertised so vigorously on all korean channels every freakin' 10 minutes before and during the show in the theaters in Korea. with such overrated comments about this movie in the newspapers and the media saying "Ground breaking computer graphics!", "Epic Sci-Fi film of our nation!" and no im not joking/lying. maybe they don't understand what Sci-fi means?anyways... /end rant

reviews.review_title: The worst movie ever!!!
reviews.content: First of all, I can't believe the Koreans consider Dragon as a concept originated from Korea... Every person knows that Dragon is an ancient concept of China.Also, the whole movie is mixed up with many things, without good transitions between the scenes. It's very uncomfortable to get a nasty gross scene of snakes with weird music 1/10 seconds after seeing a quiet scene, etc.The 3D special effects are not so good either. It copied the huge animals from the lord of the ring, but far from being real.Anyway... I already wasted 2 hours on watching this movie, and I'm not gonna waste more time on reviewing it. The point is -- It's awful.

reviews.review_title: Great Godzilla-Esc Action Movie
reviews.content: The film was a great success world wide but met disapproving audiences in the US. The film has great effects and story considering its a Foreign monster film from Korea. In my opinion its transformers with dragons instead of machines.Also Based on a real Korean legend.I found the movie quit enjoyable to watch and has interesting monsters destroying the city with great force. An army of rocket launching dinosaurs with flying impish creatures vs the human army and police. Its all out War. Its a great monster flick to watch on the weekend with popcorn and a cold beer. again, not well liked in the US but a total triumph by its first time Korean director.

reviews.review_title: Illogical even in its own logic
reviews.content: The Korean myth has its own logic. That does not explain why the hero and the lady-with-the-spirit are born in the USA. It does not explain how all the different monsters show op in the USA.The logic in this movie is absent most of the time. Jumping from scene to scene is often erratic. Why are we here, now, and how did we arrive here.Example... Why would a team of heavily armed and geared-up policemen run on a beach towards a cave, stop at the edge of a ravine, wait for a monster, be scared of the monster, run away without shooting, run out of the cave, and then start shooting.Or... Why would our hero at one point need a car and go to max speed to escape from an attack by the main monster, while a couple of minutes later he can do it by simply running.The dialogue is minimal and mostly simple. Things are explained in a silly mythical way that makes no sense at all, like something else is explained. Things happen without explanation beforehand nor afterwards.The monsters in D-War can be compared with the monsters in Lord of the Rings: Return of the King. The special effects are quite nice, but are of TV quality, not big screen quality (like LotR, Godzilla or King Kong).

reviews.review_title: Great monster movie, awesome effects don't expect Oscar nominated performances.
reviews.content: I just watched D-War and I LOVED IT! I was not expecting it to be Star Wars or Saving Private Ryan. I grew up watching Godzilla movies and I love them all (except the American one). I was expecting something like Godzilla and that is what I got. This movie has a kinda silly back story but no worse than other fantasy movies like the Chronicles of Narnia, Stardust or the Magic Compass. The acting is all decent, better than the Star Wars Prequels. The action scenes and special effects are frickin awesome! I thought it has some of the best "giant monster attacks city" battle sequences I have ever seen and the last 20-30 min are non-stop fun.The scenes filmed in Korea are beautiful and very well done. The costumes and sets used are first rate. My biggest question is why they decided to set most of it in the USA. It would have worked better if the whole movie took place in Korea.It's all about expectations. I heard this movie sucked, I lowered my expectations and I loved it. Though I wonder, who expected this movie to be an Oscar contender anyways? I think this film is far better than most Hollywood equivalents that had far bigger budgets, a-list actors and a huge studio promoting them.

reviews.review_title: Do not see this film
reviews.content: If you like Power Rangers, Korean legends(Who Doesn't), gaping plot holes and low budget Sci-Fi films then you will love this film with all your odd little heart. However, If your a normal action movie lover with logic then you will hate this film. The acting is awful, things happen for no reason, the plot jumps around more than Van Halen, and although the CGI is decent they make bad use of it. The only reason I rate this film higher than a 1 is the scene where the old lady runs into the fence... me and my friends rolled on the floor laughing. There were literally times during the movie that I was enraged at how horribly the film was made and how they could advertise the film on mainstream television with such a false representation. The commercials they show actually make the film look good, do not be fooled. I feel the need to strike the writer of this film... and may now have to be enrolled in anger management... thanks "D-wars".

reviews.review_title: What's all the whining about?
reviews.content: You have to be a complete and utter dragon freak, like me, to appreciate this movie. I don't see what all the stink reviews are about, this movie should be accepted for what it is....a fictional dragon flick. Each culture has it's own dragon stories, and this one is based on Korean beliefs. And at the end when the two serpents are fighting, when the good Imoogi turns in to a true dragon, he is an awesome sight! Fearsome, powerful, and downright cool. Yes, the film has its weak spots, but what film doesn't? So grab a soda and a bag of chips and just sink back in to your sofa and get ready for a fun ride.

reviews.review_title: Well written, fairly well acted, good fight scenes
reviews.content: I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It's destined to become one of those B-Grade cult classic sci-fi films that I love so much. That being said, my daughter asked if she could go in the lobby and play the video games at one point. The fight scenes were really well done and the graphics were down right amazing for the most part. You could really tell where the CGI ended and the models began in a few scenes though. The writing and script seemed to be very well done. Sadly, I'm sure that there are a few scenes on the editing room floor that would have helped the plot line. Backstory was provided in an enjoyable format so you don't have to know anything about the Korean folklore to understand the movie. The acting was above average for a film where the concepts were translated from Korean into U.S. concepts. There are a few things in the movie that we North American citizens probably just won't ever grasp very well. That's really just a gut feeling and I can't justify it. It was a thoroughly enjoyable film for a life-long science fiction and fantasy film.

reviews.review_title: The Movie That Could
reviews.content: What do you get when you have a movie that is trying hard to be good, but constantly suffers from bad acting, pointless scenes, awkward pacing, and bad direction?This movie, of course.From start to finish, I was making an honest attempt to become invested in the story line, but one thing after the other kept getting in the way. Probably the worst of all the issues, were the short cut scenes that didn't add anything to the storyline, or help develop the characters. Good idea - bad direction .

reviews.review_title: Despite it's creative and intriguing ideas, Dragon Wars fails due to an incredibly poor execution and uninteresting script.
reviews.content: This movie is just terrible from start to finish. I am going to spoil it for some folks. Where do I begin? Well, first of all, the storyline makes absolutely no sense whatsoever. Basically, it focuses on some ritual where a young woman has some birthmark and when she turns 20, she must be sacrificed to a giant snake in order for that snake to be turned into a dragon. There are two giant snakes. Each one is supported by a clan. The good one is named Imugi and the evil one is named Buraki. Our Protagonist, Ethan Kendrick meets and falls in love with a 19 year old girl who bares this birthmark. Supposedly, Sarah is part of this so-called "ritual".Throughout the whole movie, Ethan and Sarah are basically just running away from a giant snake and armed lizards. Nothing really happens in the movie and when something does happen it just seems pointless.At times, the plot feels unorganized and unfocused. For instance, Our protagonist has a flashback to when he was a child and opens this box and a light comes out of it. What did that have to do with anything? Also, there is this fat guy, unrelated to the story, who witnesses Buraki and goes and tells everyone about what he saw. Of course they think he's crazy, so they tie him up. Again, what did that have to do with anything? In the final act, Sarah turns 20 and she and Ethan eventually get spotted by Buraki's clan and are taken to their place. I will admit the setting and tone here is pretty neat and impressive. It's like the creators of the film put all of their effort on this one scene and then just got lazy while making the rest of the film. It's like they made the whole movie just for this final scene.Moving on, Ethan and Sarah are tied up and Sarah is about to be sacrificed to Buraki while Ethan is powerless to stop it. Then, out of nowhere, Imugi shows up and the two giant snakes have a showdown. Ethan eventually frees himself and Sarah. Sarah then realizes that the only way that Buraki can be defeated is for Sarah to be sacrificed to Imugi. In doing so, Sarah controls an orb thing and gets Imugi to bite the orb and then Sarah dies. Imugi is then transformed into a dragon and destroys Buraki. Imugi leaves and our hero Ethan is left stranded in the desert. The end. Yep, that's the whole movie right there. I just saved you 90 minutes of your life.Also, the CGI effects are downright awful even for 2007 standards. Let's just say that Sony PS1 and Nintendo 64 had better graphics than this.On a positive note, I liked the concept of the film. I think the name "Dragon Wars" deserves a better movie.

reviews.review_title: So Bad it's Good
reviews.content: This movie is so horrible it's good. When I watched this with my family, we laughed so hard when ever something stupid came up. Therefore, we deemed so funny by it's badness, that it is good. We've rented and watched it several times since then, and the scene with the soldiers going into the cave still holds the record for hardest AND longest laughter. After I watched it a few times, I asked some guys about it, and they said they saw it in the theater, and they were the only ones there. After about 30 minutes, they realized how bad it was and stopped watching. P.S. Watch the scene where they're talking on the beach, and pretend they're talking about having an abortion (close your eyes).

reviews.review_title: Dragon Wars VS. The Bourne Ultimatum ? I would take ...
reviews.content: Dragon Wars VS. The Bourne Ultimatum ?? I would take Dragon Wars.I know the weak part of Dragon Wars - an awkward script.But, I can understand it because I know the fact that the director Shim first wrote it in his native Korean and let a translator put it directly into English. ( Not adaptation but translation) So, there's some cultural gap in dialog custom and the way of talking because the script was compiled directly from foreign mindset.Those who have a good sense of language would find this script very experimental and those who haven't would be annoyed by short, dry and compact conversations which are made in English between Americans.Except the script and bad acting basically derived by the awkward script, everything else is awesome. Storyline is beautiful,and action is literally blockbuster itself.I saw the Bourne Ultimatum yesterday and it was very lame for me. Just a runaway and tracers. Very simple, no story if the viewpoint of those who say there's no plot in Dragon Wars is applied.I was very bored during watching the Bourne Ultimatum and so annoyed by incessantly shaking cameras.Resident Evil? Did you see the lame graphics when the birds fly? If you can overcome the crude script with open mind, you can enjoy Dragon Wars.I have some excuses for the actors who are being blamed for bad acting.Just imagine you wrote a scenario in English and translated it into Korean and casted Korean actors. If your movie is on screen in Korea, Korean audiences will find it unnatural and say 'acting was terrible'.This movie is foreign in nature. The fantasy and legend are very unique and special effects are great.

reviews.review_title: Brainless movie
reviews.content: The movie was very boring. The only thing i was able to enjoy was the special effects..they were great in some scenes but sucked at others. The story was shallow. It was a typical story...with typical ideas...and even typical dialog. Acting was bad...the lead actress was as cold as possibly she could be...she had no face expression...i think they chose the wrong lead actors for the movie because even he didn't seem right for the role.There were lots of gaps in the movie...lots of uncovered holes...they simply didn't take care of the details. Funny..when the black guy wanted to shoot the man in armor and he kept firing at his shield.Funny when tanks fired dozens of times but none of them hit the creatures.Funny when every time the dragon finally found Sarah it kept roaring at her until she got away. I guess monsters have to roar for a while before any further action. So typical!Funny when in the end Nathan screamed Sarah's name and a light beamed out of the jewelry he had on his chest and they all died/vanished suddenly except for 2. I guess to make it end somehow. I guess they wanted to make that moment a little touching when he screamed her name out of love lol...but they failed. Oh and it was funny when that armored man wanted to stab nathan, he stabbed the jewelry or whatever that thing was...and he simply died..lol i guess it was luck.That's just what i remember...there are more of those...And it wasn't sad that she died in the end...i don't think anyone could've felt emotional about it. She was like "Dont be sad, i will love you for all of eternity. We will be together again" i guess that was a hint that there could be another sequel..Gosh i hope not!

reviews.review_title: Excellent, under-rated sci-fi gem
reviews.content: I cannot believe some of the reviews for this movie, both here and on other sites. This film was surprisingly good. Upon seeing the poster, I made the mistake of thinking this was part of the same crappy series as "Mega Shark vs. Giant Octopus", etc. It most assuredly is NOT!The largely Korean film-making team provides us with a good story, good acting, and some amazing action sequences. The CGI is top-notch for a non-Hollywood film. This is a little hidden gem of a movie, and one with heart. If you count yourself among fans who appreciate GOOD monster sci- fi with believable acting, watch this film! You'll be glad you did.

reviews.review_title: Mr. Shim did his best
reviews.content: I am a Korean living in Canada, and I cannot stay quiet about things about the harsh comments about Mr. Shim - how sloppy the movie is, what a load of trash his stories are and etc.....Mr. Shim was a well known comedian, but for his dream to become a movie director, he had sacrificed his whole life and job. I believe in him for he is doing his best. He had once said "Comedian is my job, but becoming a movie director is my dream." South Koreans are not applauding for his movies! They are for his effort he had put in to his work! No, I have not watched the film yet, and I have heard that the movie has not much of a plot from Korean critics. But I have also heard that the computer graphic was great.Can't you see that this is a great big step for him? Mr. Shim has given up everything he had for his dream! How dare you slobbering critics think so easy! How dare you support only what you like! If you had known better, then you might as to shut up and see other's comments and reviews!

reviews.review_title: Hated movie
reviews.content: this movie was a poor film... the CG effects alone were horrible. the story line was different i'll give it that, but the entire film itself was bad.i went to the theater going to see a movie about dragons. i left the theater mad that i spent the amount of money on crap. what human can out run a giant serpent??? it was ridiculous.i myself have seen better and more well thought out films that were more of my time than this one. there were several moments in the movie were the evil serpent could have eaten or killed the main characters. but miraculously each time they run into a friend or the military enters. the film just drug on and on. save yourself the money and don't go see it.

reviews.review_title: Yeah, it's a pretty bad movie but..
reviews.content: I agree with most of the posts. (I'm a Korean living in Korea by the way).I watched it at the Korean premier.. and walked out of the theater feeling sorry for the director. Don't let the Korean box office numbers fool you. A lot of my friends went to see it out of PITY for Mr Shim (he gets crapped on by the film making community here).But is it THAT BAD? The actual story is fresh and the computer graphics were good (come on. ADMIT IT. and on that budget??) BUT The storyline was bad. The script was worse. The acting was quite puke inducing. The arirang part at the end screamed inferiority complex on part of Mr Shim. Plus, I've been reading some of the reviews and there are comments on the number of years it took to make this pretty crappy movie. The only reason that the movie took so long to produce was because investors kept pulling out and the production company was broke most of the time. Poor guy. At least kids like it.. right?

reviews.review_title: Horrible acting, corny dialogue and a less than mediocre script - but excellent CGI
reviews.content: It's difficult to rate D-War. The main characters were probably casted when they served the director lunch in a cheap diner. The supporting actors, some of them highly acknowledged veterans, obviously needed the money. The dialogue ranged from "what dialogue?" to corny. The story simply repeats: "main characters are hunted by the forces of evil, evil forces are this close to get them, but surprisingly they manage to get away", on and on and on... Yet, the CGI has been excellent, the finale even overwhelming. Especially the creature animation is one of the best I've seen so far. So, if you are lucky enough to have access to a good beamer, do what my girlfriend and I did, rent the movie, fast forward over any part that is not CGI, and look the finale twice! Ah and what I totally do not get is why they had to use European (Caucasion/white American...) actors as main characters. The Korean ones, which were seen in a flashback, may not have superstar genes, but at least the knew how to act.

reviews.review_title: What a wonderful movie, i think i will buy it and watch it over and over and over and over
reviews.content: This is one of the top pieces of sh*t I have ever seen. It is worsethan most 80s B rated movies. This is one of the biggest wastes of time. Please do not watch this, you will want to kick yourself if u do. CRAP that's all it was.... I still can't believe i actually finished it. Stay away like it was the plague! If you still wanna watch this, after please warn others how bad it was. I have no idea how this actually made it through production. Somebody must have had a lot of money to buy it's way through. I think that any movie this year would be better. I almost fell asleep during the "exciting parts" with the fighting. Need I say more???

reviews.review_title: So many haters - This is not a bad movie
reviews.content: This movie is actually not as bad as people make it. When I saw the all the bad critics here, I was not sure whether I should watch it or not, but I did.I thought, it couldn't be worse than Mega Shark vs Giant Octopus..and it clearly wasn't either.I've watched this movie twice, and yes I agree, at some points, the acting is ... not excellent. But who cares, I watched it for the dragons. The special effects are AWESOME, way better than in the trailer. The story is decent, but all the effects evens it up.Don't listen to the haters, watch this movie if you are looking for a monster movie with good CGI, not if you're looking for Hamlet 2. I am 18 years old, and I think it was a good movie. Maybe because I like to see dragons ruin cities and stuff, but I'd say this is a movie worth watching. Now, I have to go so I can watch it again

reviews.review_title: As seen on UniMas, this film's loud & charmless, if not quiet & sedative.
reviews.content: I should note that "Dragon Wars: D-Wars" showed some very pricey CGI, which were somewhat better than other sci-fi films on UniMás (previously TeleFutura). But the good graphics will be my only positive remark about this South Korean import (that I saw in Spanish - quite the international experience). I assumed this movie was based on a comic book, but either way, this film might've been overlooked in the multiplexes chock-full of movies adapted from every comic book except "Archie." (I'm sure there'll be one; the TV movie from over a decade ago where Archie & friends grow up ain't worth braggin' about.) But back to the dragon movie. Again the graphics were good & those monsters would've made some pretty cool toys. But the story of a journalist accompanying a poor, tortured young lady on a wild adventure 'cause she's the reason for those dragons terrorizing Los Angeles seems silly & necessary only to display those kickass dragons. Surprisingly, there are some familiar faces who aren't lead actors: Craig Robinson, Retta, & Billy Gardell. They now appear respectively in "The Office," "Parks & Recreation," & "Mike & Molly." In conclusion, "Dragon Wars: D-Wars" is best watched on TV w/ the volume turned up when the cool scenes are on. But anytime you see scenes with dialogue such as the suits trying to deal w/ this dragon disaster, adjourn to the kitchen or bathroom, but leave the television on when the monsters return.

reviews.review_title: Worth to view the special effect. Story is so so
reviews.content: Have to admit S.Korean's visual work is getting better, from Taegukgi, to Joongechun, all served with outstanding work. But D-war, the story is so weak. Both leading roles have no skill at all, too milky. However, the special effect of Dragon is fantastic, and scenes that fly dragons tracing chopper as well. I think 5 of 7 mark gives to visual part. The evil side was too strong when confront with modern army. Kind of old Dune stuff that could shield bullet, first time seen in films. Those moving giant rocket carrier, very superior for Hollywood. Maybe the idea is coming from S.Korean games or Blizzard's famous game "Warcraft".

reviews.review_title: Sweet!
reviews.content: I love ancient dinos with MLRS rocket launchers on their backs. Hey, if you have an evil army, you gotta pull out all the stops, right? A little field arty before the ground troops go in! What tactics, although one would think nothing would be left, given the kill radius of the rockets. Also, how did they raise and feed such a massive army? It astounds me! History rocks! My wife and I walked out of this movie and got our money back after the beach kissy scene. I'll have to go back and re watch cause this movie is just so hilariously awful...after reading IMDb reviews I actually want to see what bad stuff I missed! I have to say, I've never in my 32 years encountered THAT before.

reviews.review_title: As Stupid as Power Rangers
reviews.content: During the sneak preview of this movie (which was included in the bonus feature of the DVD),Hyung-rae Shim, the director, said that this movie "Dragon Wars" made him proud to be a Korean. But what is there to be proud about this movie? This movie simply reminds me of the ridiculous TV series "Power Rangers." Just for the sole purpose of appealing to American audience, Haim Saban and Shuki Levy, the producers of "Power Rangers" glued together ridiculously incompatible Japanese TV show with some American footages filled with mediocre to horrible acting by performers like David Yost and Amy Jo Johnson. Shim essentially did exactly the same thing. Because he wanted to make money in the US--which he candidly admitted in his sneak preview speech --Shim made "Dragon Wars," a ridiculous combination of some Korean folk legend with some ridiculous acting and outrageously stupid storyline in the style of the worst of Hollywood. Why would a Korean hero sword fighter reincarnate as a nerdy American journalist in Los Angeles? Why would a Korean maiden with magical power reincarnate as a young, blond Amerian woman in Los Angeles? That was done for the sole purpose of appealing to American audience. The director apparently did not care about this implausibility in the storyline. The director also did not care about a major goof. The boy who played Jason Behr as a child of about ten has blue eyes. However, Jason Behr has hazel-brown eyes. Eye color does not change from age ten to age thirty. That is biologically close to impossible!!Just for the sole purpose of appealing to American adolescents and young adults (who are the target audience), director Shim glued together elements from many successful movies from various countries. The dragons reminded me of Godzilla. The villains reminded me of villains from Power Rangers and Lord of the Rings. The villains' attack on Los Angeles reminded me of the battle scenes from Star Wars and Lord of the Rings. The young Korean hero and his master reminded me of various Chinese martial art movies. This movie was just a rip-off of these successful movies. In spite of his boastful speech during the sneak preview, Shim's work showed nothing unique or creative. This movie proves conclusively that artificially gluing together elements from various successful movies does not create a unique or successful movie. It was a disastrous failure.If one wants to see a unique monster movie from South Korea, I recommend "The Host" which is much more unique, creative and enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: ... Promising, but sad...
reviews.content: The title pretty much sums it up. The movie's premise, now that I've seen it (I had heard how horrible it was, enough so not to spend any money to see it, but hey, the library's free), actually seemed to have a good deal of promise. Actually, if the company and/or director really wanted too, they could probably make a good remake.Although, the script would need a major overhaul... Honestly, B-movies are allowed to have clichés, it's what makes them B-movies, but the "let's give the back story by having the main character suddenly remember something as he's writing, and have him introduce it to us slowly, explaining exactly what he's doing before he does it"... That's just sloppy writing... And come on... Evil snake is about to eat the girl, and another snake rushes in and stops the first snake. "That's the good one," says mister poorly acted main character...No, really? Darn, I never would have guessed that... It's not like they introduced it in the whole sloppily introduced back story thingy... Oh, wait...Speaking of the acting, yeah, that needs some help too... Don't get me wrong, I actually liked the old man and the sidekick. But the main characters reminded me of daytime soap...Going back to the script (it's what really needed help), the army uses some heavy artillery. I can see maybe the first wave getting wiped out by the ancient soldiers, but by the second, they'd be using armor piecing rounds, and no magical tin shield is going to stop that.Not to say that the writing was all bad. The old lady walking into the fence made me laugh and I wish the zoo guard would have been brought back (although, why wouldn't anyone believe him? He says a giant snake ate the elephants, did anyone bother to check on Dumbo? Course not...).I could go on and on, so I'm just going to tie this up. The premise holds promise (onamonapia :P ), but the script definitely would need an overhaul and some different actors would have to be be brought in.

reviews.review_title: CG is very good
reviews.content: I find the CG is very good ( even better than Transformers sometimes ). Usual movies with bad CG will be in lighter color as compare with the real human & stuff. The Transformers ( specially in fast motion ) are of quite light & soft color. You can find the last shot of Optimus Prime is much colorful as it is not moving. These creatures are quite "real", especially the last dragon's motion that "truly" behaves like an oriental dragon. The human fighting is also attractive too. The master suddenly shot fire from his hand & jump over water so "naturally" that you won't notice he is hanging by wire. Some big kung fu movies can't even match these. I think the modern actor & actress need improvement then we can "feel" more sorrow about the actress' sacrifice.

reviews.review_title: Written by a 10yr old?
reviews.content: This movie was so very badly written. The characters had no depth. They should have never made a movie of this. My 11 yr old son could write a better screenplay then Hyung-rae Shim.The only actor that didn't suck was the zoo guard. He was the only funny and believable one of the lot.I love movies and try to give them the benefit of the doubt, but this one was up there on my lame list at number 2. Number 1 being Demonicus.For those of you who actually thought this was a good movie, you are in serious need of brain surgery.Most of the creatures in the movie weren't even dragons...so why did they call D-war?

reviews.review_title: Stop Dragon My Heart Around...
reviews.content: I know there are Koreans out there who are defending this movie as the best thing to come out of Korea in a long time, and the number one grossing movie in Korea. Personally, I don't think that's something to be proud of.This movie was simply awful. I tried to give it a decent chance. I swear. But the acting was painful to watch. Jason Behr looks like a poor man's Milo Ventimiglia. A VERY poor man. I'd rather watch Hayden Christensen read Mad Libs for 90 minutes. And he was one of the better ones. None of them, not a one, could muster any sort of sympathy, pathos, feeling from me. The CGI might be the best ever from Korea, but I've had more fun watching cut scenes in video games.The plot was confusing. I know there were two dragons, one good, one evil. They were trying to get the Yu-Gi-Oh, or something like that, to turn into a real dragon and get to heaven (why an evil dragon wants to go to heaven is something for future generations to discuss). But assuming the good one got up there the first time, what happens to the bad one? It seemed to me like the good one wasn't about to jump in back in 1507 to fight the bad one, so if the sacrifice had worked, and the good dragon got to Heaven, what happens to the bad one? I guess it's tough luck, humans, try your best to invent the gigantic mongoose before Imoogi-Vader eats you all.The D in the abbreviated title stands for Deux Ex Machina. As in, man, things are stuck, so let's kick the pinball machine and get the film going again.Oh yeah, that reminds me of the old stranger I met who happened to give me an invulnerability necklace... oh yeah, that old guy just showed up to give us a ride... oh yeah, my television camera man friend has an internet scanning program that can find every 19 year old woman named Sarah with a dragon tattoo in the LA area... oh yeah, the random guy who just walked over to my desk just happened to have seen the exact woman I am looking for, saving me from visiting 2700 girls before a giant snake thing turns the LA Zoo into a buffet... oh yeah, I happen to have a professor friend who can make you remember your past lives... The script on this thing was, I am convinced, written by a pair of eight-year-olds who happened to tip over their toy box one day. Kid 1: "My guy is a ninja warrior who was trained by a master with magical powers who flies."Kid 2: "Oh yeah? Well, my guy is a bad guy with a sword that grows when he wants it to, like on Thundercats. And he has an army of armored ninjas."Kid 1: "Oh yeah? Well, my guys have cannons on the walls of their fortress, and they can blow up your guys from a mile away."Kid 2: "Well, my guys have dragons that can fly. And other dragons that have rocket launchers on their backs."Kid 1: "Nu-uh!"Kid 2: "Uh-huh!"Kid 1: "Well, there's a big dragon that lives in the water that will help my guys."Kid 2: "Yeah, but my dragon got there first, and ate your ninja."Kid 1: "No, because he jumped to his death and got reborn 500 years later as that guy from Heroes. And he has a magic necklace that makes him bulletproof, and the army helps him."Kid 2: "That's cheating!"It was worth spending the 10 bucks on, because I'll always know how bad a movie this is. If I hadn't, I'd have always wondered if it had any merit. I paid the 10 bucks to find out it DIDN'T.

reviews.review_title: Spectacular Effects Weak acting and editing
reviews.content: The movie started OK, just like all other movies. Nothing bad there. In the middle it gets lost a bit. Then the special effects start popping up and they are spectacular. The movie is full of effects and they are indeed very good. The only thing keeping this movie down is the weak acting and weak editing and some weak direction at places. Even the plot was OK. Really, some of the middle scenes jumps without any connection, really takes down the movie. Had this been directed by any good director fixing plot and acting issues, this would have been 8-9 out of 10. Unfortunately I had to give it 6/10 for those weaknesses.

reviews.review_title: Who knew a movie about dragons could be so lame
reviews.content: This is a very very very very idiotic movie and I cannot think about one redeeming feature this movie had except for the sometimes good effects. The story was idiotic and was sometimes to simple and sometimes to complex,the acting was dull,complete with blank expressions and dry line delivery and the film lacks logic or anything resembling brains. For instance there is a scene where a fortress city is under attack by a huge army complete with giant lizards monsters(dragons?)with cannons on their back. They blow apart the wall and invade. Now these creature are extremely slow and I mean slow(a 98 year old granny with arthritis is faster) yet when one guy falls down about 15 feet in front of one he doesn't have enough time to get up and run away,he just lies there and gets crushed.This action scene also looks really cheap,complete with swords that don't cut into bodies when they are slashed and cause people to twist in odd directions when slain.Then when the army is done and has captured a very important person,I wont say who it really doesn't matter,they only send about 50 guys to escort her rather than the hundreds they had to spare. On top of that some old guy comes flying through the air(literally) waves his had and blows up like 18 of them and the proceeds to have a hand to hand fight with the remaining guards and looses! If he could blow people up by waving his hand why didn't he do it to everyone,maybe I just wasn't paying attention. And the dragons themselves are pretty idiotic to. They can chase and keep up with cars going 80 mph but when chasing humans become incredibly slow.I could go on all day about how idiotic,boring and lame this movie is but that would be a complete waste of our precious time on this earth. To put it simply this is and incredibly dumb action movie that provides no entertainment due to poor acting and a horrid script and bad action. Avoid at all costs unless you want to see a terrible movie

reviews.review_title: Best thing to happen to film since Eyes
reviews.content: A while ago, at my Moms Bridge Game, I was asked what was it like when I first fell in love. I was confused, that anyone could put into words the wonderful feeling of falling in love. Being wrapped in something like that, where every bad feeling is now good, and every doubt is turned into unshaken certainty. Every rose smells sweeter, and every Sour Blow Pop tickles you just the right way. That is how I felt walking out of D-War. The beauty in everything shined forth, and I could see it. The past 16 years, I was blind, but now, thanks to Shim Hyung-Rae cinematic masterpiece, I see the world through new eyes! I wish to share that feeling with everyone in the world!This film is a film that everyone, who is physically or mentally able in any way, should watch. I hope that all of you get to see this film, and I believe that the very moment that last blind person has his eyes cleansed, the world will be happy and at peace with the cosmos.

reviews.review_title: It's just not worth anyone's time
reviews.content: I saw this with my nephew who is 12 at his request. With all the negative reviews, I can't say I was looking forward to it, but I had hoped that the "great" special effects would carry me through. They didn't. Are they good? For a non mainstream movies they are. That doesn't matter though. The movie should not be seen by anyone who has a brain. The acting in this movie is bad, very very very bad. The story line has so many holes that even giving it a pass since it is "non-western" that it insults all "non western" films. If you are thinking that you might like to see this movie, do yourself a favor and do anything else. Anything at all. Oh, and even my 12 year old nephew said it was terrible.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever. I highly recommend you see it.
reviews.content: Have you ever heard of Edward D. Wood Junior? He is the famous director that made Plan 9 from Outer Space, the man who practically invented "So bad it's good". Shim Hyung Rae has perfected this art. The plot of the film is all over the place. It didn't have a solid pacing. It had the funniest lines, unintentionally. The characters were flat, uncaring. One is a racist stereotype. When he dies, nobody notices. The holes were enormous. The acting was... how do I say this... oh, I don't know. Bad? The effects were mostly good, considering the budget. But the end sequence looked like it was made in the 80s. The army techniques are based on the needs of special effects, like shooting at a dragon with a handgun through a helicopter window, or shooting dragons perched on the side of a civilian building, probably killing everybody inside.I hereby discount it as a serious film, and it is my favorite comedy. Everybody in the theater laughed.
