It was that funny.See it.One last note: The girl lead is held in quarantine because she has a mark on her shoulder which may be an infection.It's a dragon tattoo, retards.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe I sat for the whole thing....
reviews.content: I'm sure many of us went into the theater, sat down with our friends/family, and expected the film 'dragon wars' to be a film about....oh, i don't know, dragons in a war or something. I mean, what a curve ball upon watching just the first minute of the film!! -shakes head- my younger brother was thrilled about the film and was just as disappointed, urging me to stay with the old classic, "I'm sure it'll get better soon!!" I am telling you now, it only got worse.WARNING: THE FOLLOWING CONTAINS SPOILER(s) YOU HAVE BEEN WARNEDThe film was actually about an evil dragon looking to have the 'ultimate power' found within a young woman. (or something like that, cause honestly the film was so confusing with twists and uncleared dialogs.) So this young woman knows that and does everything she can to 'stay-safe'. Then there's this reporter kid who, since he was young, knows he's got to protect this woman from the evil henchman that want the evil dragon to rule. (sighs disappointingly) Can I just say the acting, story, and the whole 'dragon war' title was awful? the only exciting part of the film was when the good dragon fought the bad dragon. Then it was ruined with the young woman offering her life so the good dragon can have the 'ultimate power'. The animation was SOMEWHAT ALRIGHT. (Meaning it could have been MUCH better) Alas folks, I give this film -10/10 but sadly i can't give such a rating so i'm stuck giving a 1/10. Seriously, if you really want to see why the film sucks, go knock yourself out and rent it/buy it. but don't say no one warned ya.

reviews.review_title: Pure creature feature/action flick!
reviews.content: Is the acting mediocre? Yes, mostly. But bad acting is frequently the result of bad dialog and bad directing, and there was a reason for this. The creatures are the stars of this movie after all, not the humans, and the action is more important than the dialog or character development as a result. This movie is about mythological creatures and the struggle between good and evil, not good character development and meaningful dialog. Visually the movie is excellent. The CGI and cinematography are as good as any I've seen and the battle scenes were riveting. This is the South Korean version of Godzilla using CGI instead of rubber suits and miniature sets. Watch it with that in mind and it's not that bad.

reviews.review_title: What a terrible let down!
reviews.content: After seeing 'The Host' I was really looking forward to 'Dragon Wars' but ended up praying for the titles. It felt at times like watching a computer game but that is probably unfair as even computer games give their characters some body or background. The acting was indeed animated and rather like the days of gaming on the Amstrad! Robert Foster deserves to be given a much more challenging role in a much more sensible and structured movie. A far cry from the glory days of 'Jackie Brown', Foster can only move on to better things.I really don't know who this film is for. I can't even see the easily pleased falling for this one. If you go to your local cinema, just to catch a flick trust me, there will always be something better on. If you feel that by some strange desire you must see this film I would encourage you to drink your favourite beer or spirit to excess before taking the plunge!! Be warned.

reviews.review_title: Great computer effects for stupidest film ever.
reviews.content: There is only one description for this one - The worst film ever made. After seeing this movie I really don't think that Plan 9 From Outer Space is bad. Don't get me wrong, computer animation and effects are great, can't be better, but the rest of the movie sucks. I don't know where to start. Scenario is bad, dialogs are even worse, but acting... I've seen school plays acted and directed better than this. Seems to me that the makers of this movie have spent the biggest piece of their money on colorful presentation of computer graphics and saved nothing for actors. ... ...I don't want to spend more words.Really, skip this one. You won't regret.

reviews.review_title: Horrendous
reviews.content: this movie only gets a second star because i work downtown and liked seeing it destroyed. the effects were pretty good- i hear it was the most expensive Korean film ever made. being the most expensive and still absolutely horrid makes it a massive waste of money. i rented it so i won't complain too much about what i paid, but it was a couple hours that i'll never get back. plot holes abound. terrible acting all across the board. i do not recommend giving up the time to watch this movie, life is too short. if your friends want to watch this, run away. i can't stress enough how bad this film was. where the hell did the second dragon come from? why didn't he show up sooner? how did they have rocket launchers on dinosaurs just 500 years ago?

reviews.review_title: "How much time is left?"
reviews.content: That's the question I must've asked myself 4 or 5 times while watching this movie. If you've ever watched a movie so bad that you wonder how far into the movie you are in hopes they can still turn it around, then you know what I'm talking about.Now, I'm writing in spoilers because I believe that people should know what they are getting into before submitting 90 minutes of there life into this instead of something more worthwhile like tweeze your pubic hair 1 by 1.First, for the first 60 minutes, there IS no war of Dragons. There's a giant snake and a really bad mock up of the army from LOTR. Doesn't sound like enough to give a movie a 2 out of 10, I know, but when the movie starts with a flashback within a flashback where a boy is left with some old antique pawn shop guy who looks like he wants to molest him, it helps. Why would you leave your only son with some man you just met trying to hock a cheap dagger? Second, when your life is in danger and you can't get out of a car because the door is jammed... why in god's name would you fight with the door to get it open instead of just going though the freaking window that's ALREADY ROLLED DOWN!!!The little dragonkin born to breathe fire from there mouths have aim so poor it is reminiscent of the Storm Troopers in Star Wars.This movie did have good special affects as far as the creatures that were made, but dear god did the directing and plot ruin the remaining hopes that this movie could be watchable. When I watch a trailer about a movie involving a war between mythical badas$ creatures like dragons, I should see that happening for more than 10 minutes of the movie. Mind you, I am TRYING to watch this as I am writing this review and the multitude of issues with the plot, script, costume design and direction are overwhelming me making me incapable of keeping up with what I want to write about. This movie was just horrible.

reviews.review_title: A good story idea wasted by bad screenplay, bad acting, and bad directing, the only good thing is the CGI effect
reviews.content: First of all, this is the first time I see an Asian dragon depicted correctly in a movie. And I give it 5 stars because of this, and also because I am an Asian myself and proud to see that Asian now can make CGI effect this good. But that's it, nothing more.For story idea I give 10 points but, for screenplay I give 0 point. For directing I give 0 point. For editing I give 0 point. For acting I give 0 point.The story idea is actually interesting but let's face it, the screenplay is a big joke. The screenplay of 10,000 BC (see my review of the movie 10,000 BC) is better. Shim Hyung-rae just cannot develop this interesting story idea into a good screenplay. There are big holes in the script, too many to be said here. Simply take Star Wars I: The Phantom Menace and splash it with Lord of the Rings: the Two Towers, there you got the script. There are many things happening in the story that are not explained, just happened like that. I mean why the police keeping the girl in custody? Why the FBI know beforehand that they have to find the girl? The acting? Whoa! No expression at all. This Tom Cruise look alike just cannot act. The girl is a bit better but there is absolutely no chemistry at all between the two. Watching a marionette play is far more interesting than watching these actors act.The directing and editing are far worst than the actors. There are many unnecessary scenes in this movie, many goofs, and again many things are not explained.

reviews.review_title: Truly Amazing. My comment helps.
reviews.content: YOu should go watch it. It's the most awesome movie ever. As a movie of a Korean director, I really admire this movie and how it's made. The director has put through so much because he was always just considered to be "COMEDIAN". But he truly was the best of all comedians in Korea. I really admire Director Shim. I hope you guy too. PLease accept the kind of different image film than Americans. There were new actors and actresses and They didn't have millions of dollars to make the movie. Please support this movie. It is truly amazing. Director Shim has shed his tears and sweat on this film for 10 years.Korea FIGHTING. and D-WAR FIGHTING. (fighting means like GO GO GO)

reviews.review_title: Quit Complaining
reviews.content: There have been many complaints about the lack of a storyline... Go watch Titanic and quit crying. If you rented a movie with the name Dragon Wars what do you expect? The story line is so-so, however I wouldn't call it bad. Overall the story line delivered and had some strong points, I won't list any spoilers. The CGI in the movie was awesome, and it hit home. This movie packs a punch as a Dragon movie and as an action piece, and I advise anybody who enjoys either to watch it. For those of you b*tching, please quit, this movie definitely served its purpose. There is only one gripe I have about watching this movie and that is the cover. I expected many dragons to be fighting throughout and this just isn't the case.

reviews.review_title: Review
reviews.content:
I hate writing too long.
It is a waste to ruin a Korean movie. Even the name of a movie is a shame.
I hope there is no one who wants to see a movie just for poster.
It is the life that does not look good.

reviews.review_title: This is SCI-FI movie! not Ammy Award Movie, so Enjoy it !
reviews.content: I heard lots of negative reviews about this movie but some good ones so I decided to see it and make my own comments.Hey, I think this is way~ better than Transformers or Alone in the Dark (even though I love Christian Slater).More over, this wasn't made in Hollywood. It was made in Korea and for that, I give very high credit!Who ever saying negatives about this or any other movies, Please~~~.If you are looking for Ammy Award Movies, you are in wrong line of category. Remember, this is SCI-FI (with some legend based and most of them are), not like Gone with Wind.This movie was made for FUN viewing not to make you think about humanity or leave sentimental value.If you want to enjoy nice CG and Sound Effect, any fantasy or sci-fi film will get you there, regardless the story line.Talk about story line, what do you expect? Sci-Fi is Sci-Fi. You don't expect George Lucas or Steven Spielburg to make all the movies, do you? And you will not watch or criticize all other makers?Give me a break.Is everyone riding Mercedez? no, we ride Ford, Pontiac, or Japan made.Same thing.I go see movie to enjoy and thank each director and actors for what they did and their dedication.As long and I enjoy and my kids have terrificcccc funnn, that is all I count.For those who are negatives, yeh, you know life is not always fair or is it?Start thinking positives and be thankful that there are people who are willing to make and do better.I give 9/10 for FUN and Good time. Go, and see it!You won't be disappointed. (disappointed only if you seek Award Movies).

reviews.review_title: A movie about aggressive worms
reviews.content: Well I could say I have seen worse.Well I did, not a lot worse.......It's an entertaining movie, but nothing more then that. It's based on an old Korean legend or something, and i must say that that is pretty original...............or is it?I thought, if you give some kids toys like Dino's and plastic army, they would come up with something similar. My opinion is that some parts were stolen from other flicks, not entirely original in some ways.But there were some great special effects in this movie. The end battle between the two worms was nice, I don't know where it took place but still it was nice.If you like a movie with some good special effects of big worms, and nothing else then you're okay with this.

reviews.review_title: Highly entertaining
reviews.content: I'm very confused at the high level of hatred for this movie. People are acting like it came to their house and beat up their mother.No, D-War hearkens back to the days of yore, when special effects laden monster movies, filled to the brim with crazy ideas and "exotic" mysteries of foreign cultures would fill the shelves at your local video store.Sure, the plot is a jumbled, convoluted mess, filled with tired clichés about "chosen ones" and "you can't escape your destiny"s. Hell, it even has that staple of 50's creature features, where a native person is dragged away while maniacally telling anyone who'll listen that "the beast has wakened" and to "heed my warning or we're all doomed!".It's a silly movie, with a silly plot, that is actually far more simple that it appears: There's a girl and the bad guys want her and our destined hero has to protect her. That's it.But D-War knows what a genre audience want: Lots and lots of action scenes and monsters. And you'll be hard pressed to mention a movie that packs as many monsters, explosions and action into an hour and a half movie, as D-War does.There are no Oscars on the horizon for D-War. But it's mindless entertainment, so grab a bucket of popcorn, a gallon of soda and be prepared to get blow away by the very impressive special effects and breathtaking action sequences that take up the latter half of the movie. Say what you will about director Hyung-rae Shim, but he is an impressive visual artist.If you enjoy the kind of cheesy monster movies where giant monsters rampage through cities and battle the military with massive destruction as a result, this is your movie. You know who you are.I certainly enjoyed it far more that Michael Bay's awful Transformers or Roland Emmerich's atrocious Godzilla. And so should you.

reviews.review_title: Don't Go See It -- It Sucks!!!!!!! Don't even rent it!!!!!
reviews.content: I was tempted to walk out on this movie after 45 minutes into it and nothing happens to propel the story forward quickly. Too much talking and not enough action. Not to mention the very bad acting. The only thing that's good in the movie (and barely at all) is the special effects, and everyone knows that that doesn't sell a movie, a great story does.To begin with the flashback had a flashback (just kill me right there). Then the main character is a news reporter. I don't have anything about news reporters being main character heroes, but his position seems to get him to places I highly doubt a real reporter would be allowed to tread. No one questions him or confronts him about what he's doing or where his train of thought is leading, they just follow along for the ride. Conflict is story. Who wrote this load of crap? About two thirds into the movie do you only see the "monsters" in current time (they were shown in the flashback, but big deal). And the flashback is misleading. It tells you there are good dragons and bad ones. Not once did I see good dragons coming to the rescue to fight the bad one and it isn't even a dragon yet, it's a snake.I finally walked out 20 minutes before the ending. I just couldn't take it anymore. Maybe the good dragon made an appearance at the end to take a curtain call and kill the main character. I didn't stay long enough to find out.This is the first movie I have walked out on in 20 years.

reviews.review_title: Mis-leading title
reviews.content: When i saw "Dragon Wars" on the shelf in my local DVD store, you can imagine my excitement at the potential of this film. I saw that title and the really cool front cover, and I bought based on that. You could say that I judged a book by it's cover, which apparently your not supposed to do. Actually, I think that phrase was coined to stop people buying Dragon Wars on an impulsive whim. It's poorly written, poorly acted, and poorly directed, while Robert Forster (Academy Award nominated for Jackie Brown) turns up for the cheque and looks bored and embarrassed in equal measure, but your not watching a film called Dragon Wars for it's strong characterisation and cinema verite style, your watching it for some wicked cool dragon fights. Does it deliver? Nope, sadly. There's like one dragon in the whole film, there's no dragon-on-dragon fights and the dragons look crap (they don't even breath fire!). Apparently, this film cost $75 million, which is weird because it looks like a cheap Power Rangers episode. Dragon Wars doesn't even qualify as a guilty pleasure, because it's just rubbish. Avoid please.

reviews.review_title: a movie to watch and enjoy if you like sci-fi/fantasy
reviews.content: I have watched this film a few times over the years with my wife and we both think these low ratings are not justified. First it is a Korean made film with great special effects with a smaller budget then most films made by united states film companies. It was a film that captured a lot of different emotions and kept our attention all the way to the end. It had a good cast including a good performance by Jason Behr. I would not let these low reviews stop you from seeing this movie. This is a movie I own on bluray and plan on watching again. I gave it a rating of 10 only because it deserves a much higher rating then a lot of viewers gave it. So give this movie a try especially if you like mystical or fantasy type movies.

reviews.review_title: A good laugh.
reviews.content: I saw this movie with low expectations and already knew that it was going to be one of those movies that is so bad, its good.Dragon Wars (or D-Wars) isn't terrible by any means. Nothing in this film can be taken seriously. The acting is corny (not bad, just corny), the plot is impossible to follow, the storyboard is all over the place, and the dialog is just plain strange. I found myself laughing during most of this film because of it.The CGI isn't that bad, nor are most of the action scenes. I find them quasi-epic.Perhaps my biggest complaint is how loosely connected things occur during the story. D-War begins with a 15 minute explanation of an old Korean legend and how the male protagonist, Ethan must find a girl with a dragon tattoo that is about to turn 20 and protect her. Apparently they are the reincarnations of the characters originally involved in the legend. That part is okay, but the execution of the events that happen in the present are just cooky.A giant CGI snake shows up and starts looking for the girl whilst destroying LA. An ancient army rises out of nowhere and follows suit. That very army, despite being 500 some years old manages to beat the hell out of our modern military. Not only that but in one scene, Ethan gets shot while protecting the girl. He gets right back up and says, "I'm OK". WTF? Oh yeah, and the whole dragon wars thing really only lasts for 2 or so minutes. The bad dragon (or inoogi) fights the good dragon (inoogi) towards the end of the film, nowhere else...This whole movie was one giant "WTF?". But I enjoyed its absurdness. It reminded me of the original "The Blob" from the 1950's. That was a strange film and this one is right up there.Honestly, this isn't a horrible film. It made me laugh, hard, very hard. The old Asian style action is there, chock-full of Dragonball style energy beams and explosions for no reason. Speaking of Dragonball, I was also reminded of the live-action Dragonball film, "Dragonball: The Magic Begins". Look it up, you'll see the similarities in story and so bad its good film making.Cheers.

reviews.review_title: what a piece of $&@^!!!
reviews.content: OK. First, for those who left positive reviews for this movie are truly altruistic, or they are just plain ol'stupid. Some Korean dude wrote a comment amassing close to 1000 words, and I told myself, either this guy is Shim, the director, or some moron who copy and paste someone else's review and inserted in this box to appear intelligent. I am so so sorry if I sound like an ass, but I am just so friggin upset that I wasted my money and time on this moda##@$in%bull^#$%.i have one last thing to say to those who left positive reviews about this movie.Please do not lie to yourself

reviews.review_title: D-War: a cocktail of whisky and .... soy sauce
reviews.content: Frankly, this is a bad bad bad and ugly movie. It contains inside a bunch of combination which is impressively stupid.1. Asian and Western This combination doesn't fit in the situation of the movie. Dragon and heaven is from Asian culture and it is so illogical to put it in western mind. Blaming for all from heaven is the way Korean movies start things but why the director and scriptwriter didn't realise that it's so fantastic and not interesting.Further more, it was so surprising for me to see Korean feudal army fights with the dark force which is totally a copy of ancient western army about costume. This weird combination is so sick and didn't work at all.2. Special effects and script Special effects for the movie is good, really really good. I have no complaint about this aspect. Unfortunately special effect is only thing make this movie a movie, otherwise it's nothing.Not yet, the movie contains the crazy and stupid script that I've ever known. I don't know how to describe, just imagine that every detail in every single scene is so illogical. One you watch, it will get under your skin, it will twist your brain till you can't calm yourself because how stupid it is. In other words, script is just simply a background for the crew shows special effects.3. Action and drama.I wouldn't rate this movie as action or drama, why? Cause it fails both. Watch it yourself and you'll see why.

reviews.review_title: Korean legend? Give me a break.
reviews.content: People take the marketing pitch that dragon-war is based on Korean legend too seriously. There's no Korean legend about a girl sacrificed every 500 hundred years for a snake transforming into a dragon, or any other purpose, period. The small flying dragons with wings have no place in a Korean or any other eastern legend, they are from a western legend, if any. The creature with a rocket launcher on its back? Give me a break. They are more likely based on legends of Star Wars. The only relevant legend is that Korea, like any other eastern Asian country, has a legend about a dragon and a saying that an old snake transforms into a dragon. But, a 50-foot snake? That comes from King Kong.Director Shim is a marketing guru. When he was questioned about incoherent script/story line of his movie, he said that his movie, dragon war, is not for the local Korean audience, it is targeting the American market and American people. Shim said that Americans mostly don't care about movie script or story lines. Shim repeatedly mentioned that American movies like "Lord of Rings" or "Spiderman" didn't have a good story line but made a huge revenue in the US market.He was quite right. Dragon war was #5 movie in the first week in the US. Shim already said that, based on the success of dragon wars in the US market, many major distributors are asking him about dragon wars 2 and he is considering releasing dragon war 2 in 2009 summer, the main movie season, directly competing against other major Hollywood movies.Shim is a very shrewd business man and his movies are all about making money.

reviews.review_title: do not see this movie!!!!!!
reviews.content: Okay. The basic gist is there's some dragons and they attack LA, and then some people run away from a bunch of scenes with dragons crawling on buildings, and somehow end up in some big dark world. Then something (I have no clue) and everything was okay. Then, it's over. I really think this movie lacked any good acting skills, a good script, or a good plot. It also contained a lot of random kissing scenes between the two main characters that met the same day. But, thank God, the movie went fast, as if it was one of those 90 minute Disney movies. My buddy Mackenzie is constantly telling me about how much she hated that movie, and how if you took out the cussing, and inappropriate scenes, it could be a movie for four year olds.

reviews.review_title: kimchi and CG only
reviews.content: D-war is like kimchi. Either you like it or your don't. Really nothing in the middle and you need to have some cultural understanding to even try it out. D-war is made by someone that didn't have Power Rangers or Transformers when little. For him, the stuff brought to life in D-war isn't a cliché but probably something he wished he has when growing up. Different ratings might be arising from this. The more you are familiar with computer graphics you know plot matters so D-war gets 1 out of 10 but if the CG was more important the plot isn't an issue so you rate it high. Basically, you should watch this movie if you want to check out the CG made by the director, and only for the CG. If you have been always tired of video game graphics being short, well, this one is for you.

reviews.review_title: With flaws...but quite enjoyable
reviews.content: O.K....the script was horrible! Some scenes looked like copy cats from Lord of the Ring, or that weird guy who transforms into a Darth Vader.. laughable. But, my husband and I really enjoyed the movie the whole time, in spite of all the flaws of the plot. The battle scenes like US Military vs the evil serpent and his monster friends, the giant serpent entwining the tall building were speedy and exciting. And the two giant serpents fighting in the sky, the transformed dragon flying to the heaven with a crystal ball in his mouth...I have never seen such a thing in any Si-Fi monster movies. Not horrible or scary looking. Rather..just beautiful! D-War is fun to watch! What else you would ask for?

reviews.review_title: It doesn't get any worse than this...
reviews.content: Seriously one of the worst films I have ever seen. I feel cheated of 90 something minutes of my life, i can only hope that this comment will save at least one person from making the same mistake I did.If films we're around in 1200BC, this would have been even more effective than Chinese drip torture...Seriously one of the worst films I have ever seen. I feel cheated of 90 something minutes of my life, i can only hope that this comment will save at least one person from making the same mistake I did.If films we're around in 1200BC, this would have been even more effective than Chinese drip torture...

reviews.review_title: after the first half of the movie I felt asleep, next day I looked the rest...
reviews.content: I you want to see a movie about Dragons watch "Reign of Fire". Forget about Dragon Wars, it's a boring movie. Some action at the beginning, some action at the end, and in the middle not that much...Why do they have to tell me the whole story in the first 5 minutes? Never heard about SUSPENSE? This movie basically tells a story based on a Korean Legend, in which every 500 years a good and evil snake fight each other to become a dragon. Why? We don't know... This can happen trough the sacrifice of a selected 20 years old girl (she doesn't need to be virgin, just 20...modern times...) because she has something magic inside hear. There is also a chosen man who has the task to protect that girl (without knowing who she is...). This guy is interpreted by Jason Behr. Jason Behr has the charm of smashed potatoes and the emotionality of a piece of white paper. There's no difference if he orders a burger at McDonalds or he tells Sarah (the 20 year old magic girl) that he loves here... During the "emotional" scene where they kiss each other his eyes are covered by his hairs, probably the director realized that he isn't able to have any facial expressions... not good for an actor... The story is boring. The whole middle part is full of nonsense, scenes that don't tell anything (e.g. the guy working in the zoo, was that supposed to be serious?). What about the scene with the FBI and the president, how silly was that.... I couldn't figure out what this movie is: is it a sci-fi movie, action movie or a fairy-tale? Probably the director didn't know also... OK, a 12 year old child would have fun looking this movie. Flying animals, explosions, magical lights and stuff showing up here and there... There are a lot of special effects and visual effects (special=analog, visual=digital; for all non experts ;-) in this movie. Sometimes they worked more or less, other times they looked crappy. The scene where the Korean village is attached by the villains in parts cold be out of a video game. And the variety of animation wasn't amazing. Especially the mass-scenes looked bad. I will just explain one scene to show the character of this movie: A guy starts shooting at the evil guy. The evil guy let appear from nowhere a little tiny shield. Why does the black guy shoot exactly in the middle of that little tiny shield instead of his lower torso, the legs?!? The movie is full off scenes of people doing irrational stupid things. I hate that.Anyway I give this movie 3 points, 2 of them only because of the stylish opening animation, 2 more points for the silly action (1 point has to be subtract for bad bad acting)

reviews.review_title: Is this the worst film ever made?
reviews.content: Yes! No words exist in the English, Foreign or Alien language that can truly describe just how bad this film really is. Write a review? You can't! I sat paralysed for about an hour dribbling in disbelief after the film had finished. Eventually I gained some movement down the right hand side of my body and managed to lean over and ejected the film from the DVD player, placed it back in the case and was about to hurl it out the window when I caught a glimpse of the back review. Surely I didn't just read that right, there's no way I just read that right. Yes I did, and I tipped me over the edge! I managed to read only the first line of the review before projectile vomiting over the cat as it walked past. It reads;DRAGON WARS is a $75Million Dollar action-packed, international box office smash hit. $75 MILLION DOLLARS???????????????? INTERNATIONAL BOX OFFICE SMASH HIT????????????????????????This is truly a landmark in the history of film making.

reviews.review_title: Very, very bad
reviews.content: The only thing this movie has going for it is the CG. And even that is subpar considered against a Hollywood-movie with the same budget.Just about everything else is horrible in this movie. Everything from the acting, the script, the dialogue to the whole plot and story is really, really bad. I don't think I've ever seen a movie with this kind of budget being this bad.It doesn't take many seconds into the film until I think it will suck. It starts sucking right when the voice-over talks over the scenery of a map.I don't understand why they had to use American actors, why couldn't they simply make it a South Korean movie instead, where everyone talks their native language. I think they had a lot of problems making a movie in a language they don't fully grasp. It probably wouldn't be that good in South Korean either, but I think it would be just a little bit better. Do yourself a favour and watch "The Host" instead, another South Korean monster-flick that is so much better.

reviews.review_title: I should have just put on a DVD of How to Grow Cactus in Less Than A Day.
reviews.content: Awful. Awful. Oh, did I mention is was awful? Oh yes, I did...First, who the hell think that some western, Caucasian dude with absolutely no acting skill can get off as the descendant, anointed warrior of destiny from the tale and lore FROM Korea! And that other, ridiculous girl with the dragon tattoo, dear god someone smack the back of the writer's head. Hard. That is on top of my movie cliché, the girl born with a mark that shows she is the predestined girl to save the world. Oh, did I mention her predecessor was a Korean, yes, a princess from some 10,000 miles away country who, in real life, was as familiar as Kim Chee to the actress.Yes, even though it was quite fun to laugh at the ridiculous acting talent from that Behr dude, the ultra cheesy storyline and creatures that came straight from an online RPG game, this movie should have stayed inside that stupid ancient Korean box from whence the shinning light chose the young Jason Behr as the world's savior from a Korean Dragon. In the dark.

reviews.review_title: Just because you can, doesn't mean you should.....
reviews.content: I just got around to watching this on DVD. I settled in for a night of special effects and hoped the story would be somewhat believable. I was disappointed. Just because you have decent special effects doesn't mean you'll have a hit movie. The story meandered horribly and the acting was non-existent. I firmly believe that most action films should be taken with a large grain of salt, but this one just fails miserably. Too bad they wasted a decent budget and credible effects on this drivel. "Reign of Fire" dealt with dragons and although it too was flawed, it succeeded more than this. It's sad to see some actors sleepwalking through a film for a paycheck and Hollywood wasting money on a sub-par film simply because they think with CGI they'll turn a profit. Better luck next time.

reviews.review_title: Really?
reviews.content: Graphics were good, but the tension is not there because of laughable interruptions. Fighting scenes were often too dark.

reviews.review_title: The first time that i saw a east Asian dragon in the film
reviews.content: Dragon wars told us a Korean legend about the dragons.I read the comments here and found the rate is so low. Maybe the plot is too weak and some scene is ridiculously naive. Maybe it's the director's fault, he just wanted to make a film combined with eastern and western culture, but he made a mess. The special effects is really good and the real dragon in the last scene is really wonderful. The East Asia dragon is different from the evil western dragon.It's a mythical creature with a huge snake-like body covered in fish scales, and adorned with horns, a beard, claws and feet.This dragon can bring the rain to the earth and the people are grateful to that. This legend is originated from China and spread to Korean peninsula and other parts of East Asia. At the end of the movie we hear the traditional Korean folk song and it's really beautiful. Maybe this movie is too short and crudely made, but i have to admit that this movie is a great surprise.

reviews.review_title: A good film that has been underrated
reviews.content: Coming from a 15 year old girl, who has a fascination with dragons, saying this film was great may seem normal. But this is one of the few dragon films I have seen recently that has held my interest and has gripped me all the way through the film. I can understand why some people think that it is a very tough film to grasp the storyline, but I think it helps watching a few dragon films before this one, and having a liking for dragons, otherwise you may be completely confused. It is a matter of opinion, but I feel that this is a version of Romeo and Juliet with a few monsters along the way. Tragic story. Check. Star crossed lovers. Check. Tragic ending. Check. I was a bit out put by the ratings on here but when I actually saw it, I thought 'What are these people thinking? This is actually really good.' Then I realised that people may not have the same thoughts as me. But if you have young children of if you are a child yourself, I recommend this film if you like stuff to do with dragons

reviews.review_title: A movie for the true multi-cultural or Asian, apparently not for Americans.
reviews.content: It amazes me just how American some of you reviewers can be. I specifically say "how American" because this movie was written and produced by a KOREAN (who isn't actually an action producer), writing about a KOREAN legend, with a focus on Asian dragon history (not Western dragon history, that is, European and American), of which Korea is part of. When you take into account that this is a Korean production, from a country which isn't quite as big and multi-cultural as the US, and if you knew anything at all about Asian mythology, then MAYBE you could actually appreciate the story and quality of the movie. (btw, I apologize for CAP words. I am not yelling, I'm only doing it for emphasis, given the lack of HTML features)As for CGI, I believe I can safely say that I've seen worse SFX in the Final Fantasy movies and Star Wars 1-3. Yes, WORSE! And I was amazed at the quality of those movies (I'm a huge fan of both franchises, especially FF). I can't believe anyone could call D-War graphics bad. The realism and quality of the Imoogi (great serpent), whom we have no recollection what they could possibly look like, except from ancient art, alone should show you that they've put considerable money and effort in creating an amazing work of art. The effect of the immense and realistic evil army was impressive, reminding me of both Star Wars and the LOTR trilogy.Admittedly, the acting could have been better, but all the actors involved have had limited Asian culture and CGI movie experience, so it's understandable that they didn't do so great. Also, Hyung Rae Shim doesn't have much experience with the American culture, so collaboration is weak, which lends to the problem of the scale of the movie.Of course, Jack (played by Robert Forster) actually did an excellent job in his part, which unfortunately, was rather limited to granting tidbits of information about what was going on for all of us to know, and to getting Ethan and Sarah (played by Jason Behr and Amanda Brooks, respectively) out of some sticky situations, like the hospital and on the bridge by driving over the Evil General (played by Michael Shamus Wiles). But, honestly, his roles in the film pretty much was limited to plot expositor, to point us, the audience, on the path of enlightenment (which most of you apparently have missed, sorry to say).All in all, I'd give this movie 8/10 for excellent graphics, strong story line, and interesting portrayal of redemption, with rather weak acting and the struggle to coordinate the two primary cultures as my two main negatives.BTW, being Half American and Half Korean, I'd probably have a small advantage over any of you, by way of knowledge and consideration, but when you also consider I haven't been in Korea since I was 4 years old, and have been raised Christian American (thus, little or no exposure to Buddhism or Asian Mythology), I'm about as ignorant as most of you. If I think this was a good movie (and if IMDb is ranking this movie 6th overall this week (21st September), and 10th for weekend gross earnings), then for those people who refuse to judge a book by it's cover (or a movie by way of poor, negatively biased reviewers), I'd recommend watching this movie, or waiting till it is released in DVD and rent it, then consider what I've wrote about cultural consideration.

reviews.review_title: This movie is probably the worst of 2007
reviews.content: Have you heard of the type of movies called "so bad it's good"? This movie is exactly that, minus the "it's good" bit.While the special effects, for a 2007 movie, are good, the writing is disgraceful. It is evidently lazy, the writer was clearly not committed to the movie. The CGI was fairly gorgeous, but the writing is so rushed and bad that it ruins the entire movie. It is so bad that at first, I thought it was produced by 'Asylum', but it wasn't. That bad.As well as this, the acting was poor. Overall, this movie is so ridiculous and rushed that you will probably lose a few IQ points and make an account just to review it. Do not waste your time, even if you want to see just how bad it is. That's what got me to write this. It's bad.

reviews.review_title: Reminded me of the old Godzilla movies
reviews.content: Am I going to recommend this to my friends? No. OK, I get why people didn't like it. I'm not going to bother making a list of the flaws this movie had because that has been done on this board several times.In it's favor I have to say that I was entertained by a lot of this movie. I thought the army scenes were exciting and the scenes with the serpents/dragons were engaging and exciting as well. I loved the Dragon scenes!The dialog parts of the film really dragged out for me. The acting was seriously like as bad as late night Cinemax soft core and the plot holes were more like cavernous trenches. But the old Godzilla movies were like that for me as well. I catch those on TV and I always watch. They are campy and fun, but I always wish the actors would shut up. In this I felt the same way and I have to say that I was rooting for the dragons/army during the people vs. dragon/army scenes. I give this movie a 6 for the action and for having dragons. I have to admit that I will watch just about any pile of pootie movie if it has dragons in it, but I have seen many movies and I have seen a lot worse than this one (and a lot better). If you see this movie, leave your brain at the door and bring in some candy or popcorn for the talkie parts and you should be OK.By the way, someone on these boards said this movie was worse than House of the Dead... maybe that's why I didn't mind this one so much. I have to say that House of the Dead was much worse.By the way, I feel like I should disclose that I dragged my boyfriend to see this with me and he hated it.

reviews.review_title: Good FX, Amazing bad movie
reviews.content: First off, this is a terrible movie. Not the worst, that goes to 'Mr. Jingles', but still very, very bad.On the back of the DVD box, the first line announces its $75 million budget. If that, combined with its name, doesn't put you off, then chances are that you may just enjoy this movie. The same way a 13 year old will.There is a plot, but it is extremely basic, not developed at all, has no meat to it, as well as being difficult to follow due to bad translations for backstory events (Ancient Korea). The characters get no depth, are emotionally shallow and have bad actors trying their worst to just get to the end of the shoot. The action set pieces are OK when averaged out. There are a few epic scenes where the CGI really does its work (and they are petty good), but then another battle sequences take a few pages from a bad power ranger episode, so there is no consistency.And the final scene will leave you EXTREMELY confused. It looks amazingly like Middle-Earth's Mordor... with no build-up! One second, the outskirts of LA, the next you expect Frodo to throw a ring at a volcano.3 stars ONLY for its FX

reviews.review_title: Best movie ever.....if you like bad movies.
reviews.content: This is a very funny movie unintentionally. This movie sucked on a very large, dragon sized scale. I'm pretty sure that this movie was supposed to be action packed, but unfortunately it was a bust. It seems as though someone saw a lot of Sci Fi movies and that they could do it worse. How did this movie make it to theaters?.....?? How? Apparently having the word dragon in the title qualifies theater time for any movie these days. The idea behind this movie wasn't even good and the acting was pitiful. This movie should be shelved away in a vault on the moon so that no one else ever has to bear witness to it's horror again. Keep up the good work.

reviews.review_title: Good CG gone to waste!
reviews.content: I am a big fan of dragons so when I saw the trailer of the movie in the TV, I felt very excited about it, it looked like a massive invasion of dragons destroying LA. Awesome right?Now, after having seen it, I can't believe producers and directives have let this train wreck happen!the CG pretty decent, and I dare to say is rather very good, so I REALLY don't understand how they could put so much money in CG for such a crappy movie.SO why is the movie so bad? the plot absolutely shallow, most of the lines are dull, and all the characters lack the charisma for you to connect with them, the world is supposed to be near its end, and you couldn't care less. The action sequences are cool, like the air combat between dragons and military helicopters, but by then you are so bored with the movie that you just can't find the fun in it.I honestly felt like watching one of those PowerRangers movies, or DragonBall:Evolution. I think the movie is more for a younger audience, certainly it has enough creatures, sword fighting and action to entertain a kid, but if you are looking for serious fantasy I don't recommend it.

reviews.review_title: It's like Snakes on a plane with Dragons!
reviews.content: If you're expecting a well developed movie with full characters and a coherent plot line than this is not a movie you should see. However, if you're expecting an over-the-top B-movie/Sci-fi flick, then you will love Dragon Wars. The plot makes no sense, the characters are cast horribly, the dragons are given ridiculous names, and the action scenes are about twenty minutes longer than necessary. This movie may become the next Ishtar, I'm calling it now. It's worth your money to see this monstrosity if you expect it to be just that, if you go in expecting a good movie, for the love of god save your money!I've had it with these motherf*ckin dragons, in these motherf*ckin wars!

reviews.review_title: D -War rocks so just enjoy it !
reviews.content: Despite harangues from spectators and cinematographers alike, it's only fair to say that D-War has every right to be a success in the United States. After all, the movie does boast a simply amazing A-list cast of American actors who were obviously attracted by something powerful enough to agree to work with director Shim Hyung-Rae. How many Korean movie directors can say that ? The long anticipated opening day for Dragon War in America was Sept .14th and here are some of the reasons it could succeed:First of all, there's the sheer novelty of having the scariest looking serpent and mini-dinosaurs spill out onto the big screen with incredible spontaneity. D-War is therefore totally major, a first for Korea and definitely a work that has inspired many of us who have never lived abroad. It's special effects justify the fact that it's the most expensive movie ever made in Korea by a Korean, even though some of the scenes in D-War require an appreciation for Shim's prior background in comedy. Several campy moments actually keep us in the creative loop, so to speak. And even those of us with absolutely no sense of humor are given the chance to make the same loop, thanks to some of the zany characters, like the zoo keeper who nearly gets clobbered to death by an elephant carcass. But why should it matter where Shim spent $33 million ? It should come as no surprise that it has always been his dream to become a filmmaker and he was willing to pay the price win or lose. Secondly, audiences in English-speaking countries will not have to be told in advance that it's a foreign film with some subtitles, which should help it succeed where others before it have failed, most notably " The Host" , another Korean monster movie that failed theatrically in areas such as the U.K. due to language barriers.In closing, D-War, like all films, is a universal medium; computer special effects give it enough leverage over more traditional methods a la Godzilla. So perhaps the main reason some members of the entertainment industry seem to have problems following D-War's message is due to their limited thinking about monster movies in general. Maybe they ought to try to remake the whole damn movie more intelligently, using different camera angles or drawings, with different scaling, instead of having the director look so derelict in his duties. Surely he must have something to boast about after six years of being so committed and passionate about this movie. So please. How you rate D-War shouldn't be based on whether you agree with such things as the size of its marketing budget or its chances of succeeding as a Korean export. And even if you don't need no good advice, go see D-War. Just remember to get a good seat, sit down and shut up! --------- I.N. Jongno, Seoul

reviews.review_title: 90 minutes of nothing...
reviews.content: This movie has opening credits, closing credits and nothing in between. It just feels as the cameraman was at all the wrong places and all the significant stuff happened somewhere else. The transition between one scene and the next is awful - it almost feels random. The whole thing leaves you with the feeling that at first it was 3 hours and they just cut in half. And the one that did the cutting was some drunk dude with Alzheimer's. The story isn't even worth mentioning. It's no wonder that the director is the writer. Nobody else would've understood a thing of that script. Usually movies which are written and directed by the same guy are either masterpieces like "Memento" or pieces of **** like this one. The only reason why I'm giving it a "1" and not a "0" is that the effects are... decent. If you paid to see this one, you've been screwed.

reviews.review_title: lol
reviews.content: okay... i don't see why people are saying it's so horrid. I mean... honestly it wasn't gonna be some epic movie! Just watch the trailer and if you thought that it would actually be bad-ass... you are just not very cool. It would be good to watch while drinking with your friends. It was pretty funny and i imagine it being hilarious while inebriated. But you know what movie sucked more than any movie i have ever seen especially because it had really good potential? THE CONDEMNED. If you wanna see a movie that SUCKS and nothing about it is good except for one actor in it (not stonecold)... then go rent it. it makes this movie look like 300

reviews.review_title: A kids movie...I stayed for 5 min.
reviews.content: I really cant judge this movie to its full extent because I cant tell you what happen the other 84 min. but i can tell you its aimed at kids(or the moderately stupid). It starts off with this achient Chinese legend that is explained so easily my 5 year old brother understood it. The acting was cheesy and you can notice that from the start it was going to be bad. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE DRAGONS. and simple stupid fun films like snakes on a plane...but the commercials are deceiving. its not that good. I don't think its even worth renting. "every five hundred years a girl is born...who is magic and brings the good dragon...and then they say something about a boy bringing a bad dragon" trust me...its definitely not worth your time.

reviews.review_title: Not worth it...
reviews.content: I personally really like stuff that has to something to do with dragons, but this really hits it, in a bad way...The storyline is really very simple, it's like a little comic book actually, not worth to make a film out of it. I won't even mention the directing! it could have saved it a little bit if there had been better cast, the acting is really awful, you have a constant feeling that there just reading the lines of the script. than why did I still give it a 3: I think some special effects are really nicely done... and because I like dragons...my opinion: it's not really worth seeing it except if you really have a serious dragon addiction.

reviews.review_title: Do not see this movie, unless you are looking for a good laugh
reviews.content: I actually didn't expect to see this movie, but when I was able to watch it at my friend's house on PPV, I have to say I have never seen such a horrible movie.The acting stuck out most, and it really is the worst I have ever seen. I am not a critic of acting (believe me, I am the most lenient person when it comes to acting) but this movie was just blatantly asking for my criticism. Let's just say I knew I was watching a movie the entire time and I was laughing at all of the stupid emotions the actors tried to convey, only ending up looking like they were constipated or had too much botox in their faces where they had no emotion at all.Let's just say the movie is down right abysmal, and I am very generous with my ratings.It had me laughing at all the stupid mistakes, it was so horrible

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: I love dragons and all that, but this movie was hard to watch. Only good part was the cgi. This movie looked like they cut out large parts to fit it into a time frame. They did not build anything into the backgrounds of the actors. This movie was so awful that I started skipping forward just to end my god awful boredom. it did have some very cool fight scenes and that was the only thing in this movie that was worth it. Avoid this movie if your over the age of 12 unless you like bad movies with bad acting. My goodness this movie was so bad I think it gave me cancer! ^_^

reviews.review_title: The inbred half brother of all disaster movies
reviews.content: With so much famine and poverty in the world it makes me wonder how a movie, with a budget to feed a cluster of third world countries, ever got made. D-War struck me as potentially the worst, and most confusing, storyline in the history of the business. For the movie buff with little patience, D-War will make you count the tiles on your ceiling. The story gave little hope to the actors abilities as the script was written in riddles from the start. The only positives i can give to finished product was that one of the main characters dies in the end, finally getting rid of the wooden display of theatrics. Like many of its brothers (godzilla, king Kong), the main story was acted out on the mean streets of the USA, the perfect battleground for an age old myth. The reality was invisible and frustrating and i was counting down to the obvious final scene. I read D-War stands for "Dragon War", don't believe the hype kids, it stands for "Did i just spend 2 hours out my life watching this crap!!-War".

reviews.review_title: Very Imaginative
reviews.content: I can only guess that the people who gave this movie such bad reviews didn't have brains enough to follow its imaginative storyline, or appreciate Sci Fi Channel product that (for once!) was more plot than gore.Do yourself a favor and pay no attention to these obviously over-the-top pans.A fun mixture of martial arts, fantasy, Korean mythology (which I was totally unfamiliar with, prior to seeing this), D-WARS offers a unique cultural angle on the standard dragon legend, with solid effects and better-than-SciFiChannel- average acting.

reviews.review_title: Monster-Movie!
reviews.content: Watching this movie was a lot like watching all your favorite horror movies get torn apart by the scary-movie team. Cause thats what this is... Monster-Movie! A mix of King Kong, Godzilla and all the rest of them... It was awful... Nothing worked, nothing was explained at all! Stuff just happened and all of a sudden the good guys won cause of something which was never explained in any way... Rubbish! The dialogue was funny, but not supposed to be, so it never gave the desired effect... The animations were at the same standard of most PS3 or X-BOX 360 games which is good for a game but not for a movie.All round just plain stupid, and Behr should stick to Smallville cause he's just not any good...

reviews.review_title: Yuck!!
reviews.content: Sigh!Why spend so much effort on CGI and effects if the story is so badly written and yes, badly directed too. It seems to me that all the writer cares about is to show off his ability to direct a movie full of CGI.If it wasn't for Amanda Brooks, I wouldn't have watched it till the end.She is cool though.Much better than the 'hero' who despite being reborn again still has only 1 thing on his mind - I MUST GET THE CHICK. WHO CARES IF THE THOUSANDS ARE DYING. AS LONG AS I CAN GET TO LIVE HAPPILY EVER AFTER WITH THE CHICK.LEAVE THE FIGHTING TO OTHERS.MY JOB IS TO FIND THE CHICK, BRING HER TO SAFETY AND HAVE LITTLE BABIES. Well, it just goes to show what's on the director's mind..sigh.. Actor/Actress beware, these are the people who can KILL your career. Enough said.

reviews.review_title: Watch this with a bag of salt!!!
reviews.content: I always watch movies with a open mind, I find even with bad movies a person can find some kind of enjoyment with parts of the movie. This movie was a perfect example of a "B" style, campy, made for Sci-Fi channel movie. You need to know going in to this that the acting will be sub-par, the special effects will be sub-par and the plot will be well below par. However, I found myself sitting through the entire movie thinking "this movie sucks" but I kept watching. Why?, you ask, maybe I'm a sucker for dragon movies or bad CGI or a hot girl running around spewing bad dialog. Whatever the case, this movie isn't the worst I've seen but I do refuse to watch D-Wars part 2 if they make one. (unless it has a really hot girl in it)

reviews.review_title: Best Sc-Fi Movie I've had the pleasure to see in a long time
reviews.content: If you like Sci-Fi, Monsters, and Ancient Legends, then you will love this movie!! The Special Effects are by far the best I have seen since Juarassic Park hit the big screen years ago. While the acting may have been a little less than desirable, the story line and effects adequately compensated for it.I wish now I had seen this at the movies on a theater screen instead of our 42 inch big screen TV.If you like non-stop action, awesome visuals, and taste for myth and lore....you have to see this movie!!

reviews.review_title: Kids loved it
reviews.content: I saw this film last night on television together with my son and nephew of 10 and 12. They really enjoyed this flick. I noticed with them they are looking for something interesting to watch. And this movie has some interesting stuff to watch. Mythical creatures, cool bad guys, cool battles and also some humor. So we were really entertained.I think nowadays we are really spoiled with film and nice special effects, top notch production etc. I think it's important if something is made with heart in it. And I feel the director, producer really did an effort to make his vision into this film. On itself it's an enjoyable film with reasonable special effects, storyline and acting. It gave us a nice time together and I'm thankful for that

reviews.review_title: one of the worst movies i have ever seen!
reviews.content: I have been watching movies for 18 years (my whole life), and i know when a movie is god awful, and folks,...well its just that! Dragon wars is on a scale of 1 to 10, a two, because the only thing that was good about it was the CGI. The dragons looked bad ass, but the script? the dialogue? the acting? BLAH! all of it was a mess. The dialogue is as cheap as it gets. Although the actor i found rather hilarious, and good was Bruce, Ethans friend. I love that actor, and he was enjoyable in the movie. But everyone else was just bad. The story, or plot could have been MUCH better! The first time i saw this movie, it was on the SYFY channel, and i seriously thought it was a SYFY original, because of how bad, and cheap it was. But once i looked it up, i was stunned to figure out this movie actually hit theaters!! i immediately felt bad for the people who wasted 90 minutes, and 10 bucks to watch this crap. It was original, yes. The CGI was good, yes, but I'm sorry, it just does not make up for all the faults (and i do mean A LOT) in this movie.

reviews.review_title: I finally saw this movie!!
reviews.content: Ha Ha! I gave it 10!! I saw it in Mann Chinese theatre, Hollywood! THX!! It took me a while to get what this movie was all about.But I finally got what it was all about at the end of the movie.I have experience seeing the director's previous movie before, and I didn't like it then.But with this movie, I finally began to appreciate the director's work.I WAS SO IMPRESSED AND (REALLY CRIED) AFTER THIS MOVIE.The movie is original and is an work of art.But I admit it would be hard for normal viewers to appreciate the movie.Let me give u an hint.Children would like it very much, because it's all about imagination.Children don't care about philosophical/sophiscated stuff. That's only for adults.And for an Adult, if u are smart enough, u would really enjoy this movie.The movie is for everyone.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says, if you go in with the right frame of mind
reviews.content: I don't know why everyone says this movie is so horrible. I agree, it definitely will not win any awards but what the hell did you expect from a movie called "DRAGON WARS"? Did you expect the plot to be phenomenal? Because I didn't, I went into the movie expecting exactly what the title says, dragons having a war and blowing s*** up, which is exactly what happened. The monsters were sick looking and the fight scenes were fun and exciting. Movies are all about going into them with the right frame of mind, if you go into a drama expecting a comedy, you won't enjoy it even if it is a good movie. If you go into this movie expecting something great, then you won't enjoy it, but if you go into it wanting to just be entertained for 2 hours then you probably will enjoy it.The acting is decent...some good some bad. It was a little slow at the beginning but once the dragon/snake starts destroying the city, it gets pretty fun. Please don't go into this movie thinking it is going to be God's gift to humanity or else you will be sorely disappointed...because it's not and it's not trying to be. It's just trying to be a fun and enjoyable movie, which I think it accomplishes.Obviously if you don't like Godzilla-esque movies you will not enjoy this film, so don't go watch it then b**** because you don't like it. It would be like me going to watch a chick flick and then complaining because I don't like chick flicks. If you like seeing monsters fight and destroy cities then this is the film for you. I think that there have been MUCH worse films than this, and I think it's worth a viewing. I give it a 7 out of 10 because it is nothing special, but it accomplishes what it means to and I enjoyed the cheesiness of the whole movie.

reviews.review_title: The "Axe Cop" of films.
reviews.content: Axe Cop (as it explains on the website) is drawn by a 29 year old but written by his 5 year old brother. One cant really fault whats on the screen in Dragon wars. but everything behind the pretty pictures seems like it was put together hurriedly as part of a school project. You know what i mean when you start saying things choice phrases like..."Er, what?", or "what's he doing here?" and the classic "why would they do that?". I don't know much about the writers but I think they took lessons from from class 1a. You know, the kids who play in the sand pit with their action figures....making sure the good guys always get away "just in time". its this total lack of real drama and logic that REALLY makes it seem immature.NEVERTHELESS as with axe cop as long as you're not looking for anything too serious you'll have fun. Especially wondering "how did they decide that this was right?"

reviews.review_title: For this popular of a movie, it is horrible...
reviews.content: With mediocre acting, a bad storyline, and a completely corny plot, this movie was really really really bad. I rated it a 2 for two reasons, the CGI is fantastic, and there are 2 scenes where the main bad guy in the plot gets it by a car, and they are the 2 times in my life where I have laughed the hardest. Other than those 2 things, it really was a bad movie. The idea of incorporating the old kung-fu master is SO corny and stupid, that I was able to guess it from the beginning. You need to be really young, or really appreciate CGI to think this movie is better than 3 or 4 stars. Why this movie is doing better than some other very good, but unknown movies/not in theater movies is beyond me. Overall, ONLY watch this movie if your kids REALLY beg you to, because you WILL be bored.

reviews.review_title: So bad its hilarious
reviews.content: OK this is probably the worst done movie i have ever seen to be honest, my friend got it for me for my birthday and we watched it together. The thing is its SO badly done that its actually funny! We were laughing our asses off through the whole thing! At some point i had to question if the movie was meant to be serious or if they were trying to be funny but i'm guessing they were actually trying to be serious which just cracks me up. The only thing i liked was the cgi, and it seemed to me like they spent all their money on a special effects guy who did a great job btw but then had him write the script. Yes its that bad. So to sum it all up, the acting, plot, premise, and execution were all terrible, but it was bad enough to a point where i'm actually glad to have it and would watch it again just b/c i get a hell of a laugh out of it.

reviews.review_title: This is great movie
reviews.content: This is much better than Starwars 8 Last Jedi. It has better plot, better CG, better acting than Last Jedi. Director Sim is much more talented than lion Johnson.

reviews.review_title: Intelligence Falls For Having Watched This Film
reviews.content: Though sub-par acting can almost be forgivable, due to its own absolute laugh-ability, when it is coupled with pathetic CGI efforts and an even worse plot line, you have yourself a cancer of the IQ. Sci-fi Channel has produced better made-for-TV movies, including Frankenfish and Lake Placid II. Yeah... I said it.Watch at your own risk. If you entered into the viewing of this "film" with abject adoration, then I fear your newfound stupidity will stick. In such an instance, I'll be sure to pray for you. Long and hard.

reviews.review_title: What the hell was that....?!
reviews.content: I thought I'd seen it all but this was truly horrific. Before seeing this, my 'worst film ever' award went to 'The Producers' because it bored me beyond belief. I bought this film this very weekend with high expectations, and finished it just now. I came straight online to see what other reviews it got and I am glad to see that I was not the only one who was left mind- boggled at its inadequacy. Where to start...it really was that bad! First off, it was too short. From experience, most films under this are usually cheap and not well produced; understatement of the century!Now I'm English - fair enough the director, is 'supposedly' a very popular comedian in Korea, but do you see Peter Kay running about directing films? No. Simple as.The Plot - Transformers attempt with Dragons is what most people expected. Difference is, Transformers had a plot - this had nothing. It was not made clear at all when the plot kept branching off, maybe this was through time restrictions, but I guess they just blew the whole 75mil on CGI! I found myself constantly laughing with cliché after cliché. How did two random strangers meet up, and in the same day, understand what was happening without actually explaining how their fates were linked, and GET OFF WITH EACH OTHER? What the hell was that about? Okay, they loved each other in a previous life, but seriously, cm-on.. Oh, and the random inaudible gurgling from the 'guy in black'. Too much went wrong with the plot to explain the rest..ACTING (oh dear) - I had to mention the chase sequence through the tunnel (Ethan, Sarah and reporter friend) first because I just couldn't believe what I was seeing! Okay, he was told of a snake but they could have at least showed some emotion when a 300 foot long snake is chasing you - THEY JUST KEPT TURNING AROUND - ?!?!? - I COULD NOT BELIEVE IT. At the end, it was the old 'did you see that'. Oh dear.Okay, if you're 8 with no clue what is ACTUALLY going on, then you'll love it, or if you're Korean who had actually heard of this before the film. Anyone else - do not, I repeat, do not waste an hour and a half of your life over this monstrosity. If Koreans enjoy this, then I have to say, they have a warped sense of entertainment. That was a shocking performance in all aspects except CGI. The creatures to be fair were well made. That's all I'm gonna say. Oh, and did anyone see the choppers which manoeuvred like F16's? It was a joke from start to finish, I am tempted just to destroy this film now. But hey, you could play a good prank and give it to someone to watch, claiming it's the best film you've ever seen - they would probably come for you in the night!P.S L.A >>> Mordor - WHAT....THE....*AHEM*....HAPPENED.....THERE...

reviews.review_title: Awful...in every sense of the word.
reviews.content: The story was so-so to start with, and I wouldn't say that there was bad acting, so much as bad writing. The action, was pretty terrible. I actually read somebodies review that said the final 20 minutes had some good action...I must disagree. The evil army, luckily falls into the hole in the earth created by "The Heavens", summoned by the magical necklace. Which, speaking of, saves the hero from a sword fight. He is stabbed, yet the magic necklace saves him. Oh, and it saved him from a gun shot. Basically, the story would have turned out well for the hero's, because the necklace existed...that is what I took from this movie.Also, speaking of the gun shot. You know, some movies, people are shot, and a cross, bible, other object they have on a necklace or in their pocket saves them from dying...but not here. Our hero is shot, and just shakes it off. They don't even really say anything like..."Wow dude, you just got shot, are you OK?" or..."Holy crap...that dude just shot you from like two feet away, did you catch the bullet with your teeth like you're Bruce Leroy in The Last Dragon?"...Which by the way...way better movie than this. Nor did they say the obvious..."Holy crap, I just got shot point blank, and shook it off...how did I end up in this movie...remind me to fire my agent." NO...they say..."Are you OK?" He says yes...and they just walk off.In short...if felt like a story that should have been about 3 hours long, with more explanation and character development...but, sadly, what you got was...Hey...that movie you guys asked for a twenty-five million dollar budget for...here is a dollar eighty for the movie...a few hundred grand for some special effect, and here's three hundred grand...because some how we talked Robert Forster into being in this movie. Oh yeah...and you need to knock off an hour and a half. Sorry.Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: A cruel, underhanded stab at our curiosity.
reviews.content: I haven't been this shocked and horrified that a move made it to theaters since 2005's Blood Rayne--and even that had more integrity than this. In fact other than an obviously decent budget for CGI effects, 'D-War' doesn't even meet the standards of most SciFi original monster movies. The characters are flat, unrealistic, and at times just plain ridiculous. The plot is nearly nonsensical.At first, I thought that ninety minutes was rather short for a movie of its nature, but it turns out that an accumulative thirty minutes of it was completely trivial and could have been cut. Twenty minutes into it I desperately wanted to leave, but sadly I was not the one who drove there (not that I didn't contemplate the hour long walk). I have never been so bored watching beasts devour and/or maim a city full of bystanders, no matter how intense the musical score is trying to make it.I am embarrassed that I sat through this thing. But if I can convince one innocent soul not to see this movie, perhaps it was all worth it.

reviews.review_title: So awful it's actually entertaining.
reviews.content: My friends and I used to watch this when we have had bad movie nights. It's so ridiculously bad you will laugh pretty much every time the movie is supposed to be serious or dramatic. The intro features giant Jabba- like turtle creatures with cannons and people being slashed to death by giant swords without even suffering a visible rift on their clothes. It also shows defenders with colorful carnival costumes making a hopeless defense, freeze the picture when it shows a group of defenders at the wall, you have to. Be aware of the scene in the intro where the dude and the girl fall from a cliff to escape the snake. It looks like the guy is first considering to defend her but then suddenly goes "fuck this", grabs her and jump down. You also have to laugh at the flying old ninjas fighting in the forest. This movie simply has a countless number of hilarious scenes where none was supposed to be. The fact that the giant snake is never seen by any citizen when roaming around the city in the beginning of the movie is so annoyingly unlikely. This movie is impossible to be take seriously. If you're about to see it you MUST 1: Count how many times Ethan and his girl runs/drives away from the giant snake and then stops to talk and relax, at for example the beach or at a restaurant before the snake suddenly reappears and the same thing happens over again. And 2: How many Asian people are named Kim or Chen in the closing credits text at the end. Might be cultural ignorance or something but we couldn't stop laughing.From a serious POV it deserves no stares at all, it's a mess. On the other hand it's a ridiculous mess. If you want to watch a good, solid, serious fantasy-movie, RUN, RUN FAST. However, if you want to watch one of the funniest "not supposed to be a comedy"-movies ever it's a MUST. This movie hangs in the balance between the fact that it's unbelievably bad and the fact that it's one of the funniest movies ever, which makes it a 5.It's like the leaning tower of Pisa, the constructors failed and that's what made it famous.

reviews.review_title: "A movie from Heaven" Two Thumbs UP !! What an excellent movie for family.
reviews.content: I Think That D-war was one of the BEST Films of the 2007. The Visuals were excellent as well as the acting.D-WAR is a spectacular and magnificent achievement for everyone involved. The sheer logistics of making such a film are mind-boggling.Director Hyung-rae Shim has fashioned a magnificent work of art that will, in all likelihood, be hailed decades from now as one of the greatest achievements in Cinema.I watched this 3 times in the theaters. And It truly deserves the Gross it gained as well as the awards.For me If you don't like this Film It is Probably because you can't understand it. I would encourage anyone to watch it. It is the movie of the decade. Simply put... ?D-war? is one of the greatest motion picture experiences I imagine one could ever have! It deserves every ounce of praise it has received, every award it has won, and every Top Ten list it has made. When was the last time you watched a movie and after felt so good that you wanted to kiss everybody in the theatre? Well, perhaps I exaggerated a little but this movie was everything I was waiting for.The moment D-war came to the screen I yelled so much I nearly passed out! It wasn't only me, everybody was. This movie was for our generation, the younger generation who were grown with Dragon-wars. You, critics, should stay away from movies that have absolutely no connection with because you simply don't understand them.Director Hyung-rae Shim has fashioned a magnificent work of art that will, in all likelihood, be hailed decades from now as one of the greatest achievements in Cinema. This movie rocked in every possible way, bring your parents, your friends, your friend's friends, even people from street to watch it and prepare to be amazed :D
